title: Assistant Professor (f/m/d) - in the area of social data science...
description:
Starting date: January 1, 2024

Application deadline: Review of applications will begin September 15, 2023, and will continue until the position is filled

Full Or Part Time: Full-time (40 hours/week)

Location: Vienna, Austria

The Department of Network and Data Science invites applications for a Full-Time Faculty Position at the assistant professor level in the area of social data science and social network science.

The Department of Network and Data Science is an interdisciplinary unit, integrating natural science and social science approaches. Further information about the Department of Network and Data Science is available at: http://networkdatascience.ceu.edu

Qualifications:

We expect applications from social data scientists, social network scientists, or quantitative social scientists. The candidates should have strong motivation to conduct interdisciplinary research and be interested in participating in projects with several departments at CEU. Capability of high-quality... teaching is assumed.

Candidates should have a PhD in social sciences (sociology, political science, communication science, computational social science, social network science, etc.) as well as an excellent record of publications in international peer-reviewed journals, proof of successful teaching, and good recommendations.

Teaching load is comparable to that of research universities. The normal teaching load at CEU is 12 taught US credits per academic year, plus thesis supervision.

Compensation:

We offer a competitive yearly salary of 62.500 EUR, as well as additional benefits (e.g., pension plan). The initial contract is for six years. The contract can be turned into an indefinite contract depending upon review.

How to apply:

Applicants need to submit:
• A comprehensive C.V., Names of three referees (candidates should ask two referees to send recommendations directly to the CEU), List of publications, A sample publication, A short statement of research and teaching.

Review of applications will begin September 15, 2023 and will continue until the positions are filled.

Questions of academic nature may be addressed to Janos Kertesz, Head of the Department of Network and Data Science (kerteszj@ceu.edu)

Please send your complete application package to:

advert045@ceu.edu - including job code in subject line: 2023/045

CEU is an equal opportunity employer and values geographical and gender diversity, thus encouraging applications from women and/or other underrepresented groups. Since CEU strives to increase the share of women in professorial positions, given equal qualifications, preference will be given to female applicants.

CEU recognises that personal and family circumstances shape the trajectory of one’s career and working patterns. We encourage applicants to detail periods of leave, part-time work or other such situations in their applications so that the Search Committee can assess an applicant’s academic record fairly in the context of their circumstances. Any declaration of personal and family circumstances is voluntary and will be handled confidentially and only considered in so far as it impacts on the academic career of an applicant.

To contribute to CEU’s monitoring efforts to improve gender equality in the academic body, we kindly ask you to fill in this form with your gender identity. The provision of this information is optional and will be used for statistical purposes only.

The privacy of your personal information is important to us. We collect, use, and store your personal information in accordance with the requirements of the applicable data privacy rules, including specifically the General Data Protection Regulation. To learn more about how we manage your personal data during the recruitment process, please see our Privacy Notice at: https://www.ceu.edu/recruitment-privacy-notice-austria

About CEU

One of the world’s most international universities, a unique founding mission positions Central European University as both an acclaimed center for the study of economic, historical, social and political challenges, and a source of support for building open and democratic societies that respect human rights and human dignity. CEU is accredited in the United States and Austria, and offers English-language bachelor's, master's and doctoral programs in the social sciences, the humanities, law, environmental sciences, management and public policy. CEU enrols more than 1,400 students from over 100 countries, with faculty from over 50 countries.  

In 2019 CEU relocated from Hungary to Austria as the Hungarian government revoked its ability to issue US-accredited degrees in the country. As a result, CEU offers all of its degree programs in Vienna, Austria; and retains a non-degree, research and civic engagement presence in Budapest, Hungary, through its CEU Democracy Institute, the Institute for Advanced Study, the CEU Summer School and The Vera and Donald Blinken Open Society Archives (OSA), and its Hungarian language public educational programs and public lectures

title: Job in Germany: (Senior) Data Scientist / Machine Learning Expert...
company_name: EMUGE Werk Richard Glimpel GmbH & Co. KG
description: As an owner-managed group of companies, EMUGE-FRANKEN has been one of the world's leading suppliers of precision tools for over 100 years. Around 1,900 employees develop, manufacture and distribute innovative threading, drilling and milling tools as well as testing and clamping devices for numerous industries. We are looking for a for our machine software development department (Senior) Data Scientist / Machine Learning Expert (m/f/d) Field of Activity: Consulting of different areas regarding the use of ML algorithms. Pre-selection and structuring of large and complex data sets. Conceptual design of innovative ML solutions, also in the manufacturing environment. Preparation of potential analyses of the algorithms in the corresponding projects. Implementation of the conceptualized solutions with different programming languages. Evaluation and documentation of the algorithms by means of experiments in practical use Deployment and maintenance of ML solutions on different systems... Professional / Personal Requirements: Completed master's degree in data science, computer science, mathematics, electrical engineering, or a similar field. Several years of experience in data modeling, ML theory and statistics. Good knowledge with different programming languages (C#, Python, R, Matlab). Hands-on experience with ML libraries (Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.). Basic knowledge of data visualization and SQL / NoSQL databases. Profound knowledge in MS Office (especially PowerPoint, Excel and Word). Very good knowledge of German and English, both written and spoken High degree of teamwork as well as an independent and structured way of working. Quick comprehension even with complex technical contexts Expertise in mechanical engineering or manufacturing environment is desirable We offer: Challenging and interesting work content with a high level of personal responsibility. Design freedom within the framework of the introduction of a new technology Diverse professional development opportunities (e.g. training, workshops) Pleasant working atmosphere in a committed and dynamic team Performance-based remuneration based on the Bavarian metal and electrical collective agreement and interesting employee offers (corporate benefits). Secure job in the environment of a medium-sized family business This is a full-time job; not suitable for part-time. Are you interested? Then we look forward to your meaningful application to: EMUGE plant Richard Glimpel GmbH & Co. KG Factory for precision tools Human resources department Nuremberg street 96-100, 91207 Lauf bewerbungenemuge.de www.emuge-franken-group.com

title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
description:
Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)

We at the Advanced Analytics & AI tribe take care that innovation is done right within RBI group. Our team has already delivered numerous successes in this area. We are agile, creative and have a hands-on mentality. And we are looking for like-minded people to join us.

Do you want to combine the enthusiasm and flexibility of a start-up with the solid background of an established bank? Are you energetic, enthusiastic & passionate to apply creative approaches and techniques with data, which plays the most important role in a modern bank? Do you want to work with the state-of-the-art cloud infrastructure (Databricks on AWS)? Are you ready to shape the future of the financial industry within Central and Eastern Europe? Then you are the right person for our team!

#full-time

(38.5h / week)

#viennaoffice

(1190)

#homeoffice

possible

Your role at RBI
• You execute a wide range of use cases across all business lines, prove hypotheses and bring in your own... ideas
• You predict customer behavior, conversion probabilities, churn rates, define target groups, detect suspicious transactions supported by Machine Learning
• You translate data analysis findings and research results into concrete actions
• You visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats
• You be the missing link between business experts, IT and Advanced Analytics & AI
• You teach and train more junior colleagues in data science to further develop these capabilities across RBI

Your core competencies
• You have worked in the field of Data Science in a large corporation for about 5 years
• You have profound knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques
• You come with good scripting skills (Python or R) and knowledge of most popular machine learning libraries
• You have a strong track record of successfully delivering data products, services or insights where you had to understand complex data flows and business processes
• You are fluent in English; German is appreciated, but not mandatory
• You have the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively and comprehensively and you can stand criticism without losing your smile

Nice to have
• Experience in financial services is a strong plus

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance : f lexible working hours (no core time) & extensive hybrid working possibilities
• Meaningful Career Options : to develop personally & professionally
• Learning : as part of our DNA & culture
• Easy Moving : work permit support
• Easy Commuting : free public transport pass
• Canteen : healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Leisure time activities : attractive sports and cultural offers (free museum tickets, reduced gym membership, etc.)
• Saving : with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. for supermarkets)
• Free : Salary account and credit card
• Family Friendly : family allowances, gender-neutral parental leave, part-time work, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
• Salary : starting at EUR 60.000,- gross p.a . including overtime (market-compliant overpayment is provided dep. on experience / qualification)

At Raiffeisen Bank International , we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people . From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website or check out our FAQ . If you have any other questions, feel free to contact XX (optional) OR Please address your application letter to XX (optional).

Follow us on our RBI Account on
LinkedIn

title: Senior Data Scientist (Digital Manufacturing) (m/w/d)
description:
• Delivery of data science projects in digital manufacturing at production level
• Preparation of requirements analysis and collection of data
• Provision of the solution architecture
• Creation of custom deep learning models based on open-source tools with a focus on computer vision

your profile
• Completed studies in mathematics, statistics, data science, computer science or a similar subject
• Several years of professional experience (3+ years) as a data scientist or in the field of digital manufacturing
• Experience with AI in the cloud, preferably Azure (AWS, Google Cloud)
• Very good knowledge of Python and/or R
• Basic knowledge in areas such as Big Data, data analysis and data storage systems (SQL/NoSQL Database, Data Lake)
• Very good knowledge of German and English
• Ability to work in a team and convincing communication skills
• Excellent analytical skills and a proactive way of working
• Openness to possible international project assignments

The following skills would be... beneficial
• Experience in digital manufacturing or in the production sector
• Experience in IoT and Industry 4.0 in project work
• Knowledge of using BI and data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau)
• Experience in (partial) project management

benefits
• Internationality: an interesting and diverse working environment at the largest IT consultancy of European origin, as well as a wide range of career opportunities through working within an international group, which is represented in over 40 countries and whose employees themselves come from over 100 countries
• Responsibility:working independently – creativity and innovation are very important to us
• Flexibility: flexible time management and location-independent work to optimize the work-life balance

Further development:
• Your further development is important to us and we have learning platforms, exchange with global experts and international communities, as well as strong technology partners at your disposal. Training and certifications are also part of your personal development
• Team spirit: we are looking for team players who can identify with our values ??and fit into our young and dynamic team
• Events: we offer numerous team and company events as well as numerous attractive employee offers

Our company is subject to the collective agreement for employees in information and consulting. An annual target salary of between EUR 55,000 and EUR 95,000 gross is offered with overpayment in line with the market, depending on qualifications and experience.

We look forward to receiving your application in English

title: Data scientist (f/m/d) Maternity leave replacement, fixed term...
description:
This is what you can expect

– You are responsible for data preparation and data blending using various programming languages for our technical and main departments.

– You will provide support with drawing up statistical models for Wiener Linien data, will develop various KPIs and develop these further.

– You will design and develop machine learning algorithms.

– You will work on creating complex analyses for new, system-optimised processes and modelling and assist with forecasts.

– You will generate business value for Wiener Linien based on complex data problems.

– You will be responsible for visualisation, preparation and presentation of data insights.

This is what you will contribute

– Ideally you will have completed a leaving certificate („Matura“) at a polytechnic or a technical degree in the field of data science, mathematics, IT or similar.

– You have relevant experience in the commercial use of advanced analytics, machine learning and statistical modelling.

– You have... very good mathematical and statistical knowledge and wide-ranging awareness of IT and big data technologies.

– You have advanced programming knowledge of the script languages Python, SQL, R or similar. Ideally, you will already have successfully completed data science projects.

– You are skilled at preparing, processing and visualising data and creating dashboards (Qlik, MS Power BI, Tableau or similar).

We keep Vienna running day-to-day and accept responsibility for the people in this city – including for their health. To protect our colleagues and customers, we therefore prefer applicants who have already been vaccinated against Covid-19 or who are willing to be vaccinated

– You will design and develop machine learning algorithms.

– You will work on creating complex analyses for new, system-optimised processes and modelling and assist with forecasts.

– You will generate business value for Wiener Linien based on complex data problems.

– You will be responsible for visualisation, preparation and presentation of data insights.

title: Job in Germany: Team Leader in Data Science Services (m/f/d...
description: The Deutsche Bundesbank is a special bank: an integral part of the European System of Central Banks with an important function in financial stability, banking supervision, monetary policy and payment transactions in Germany. Above all, however, we are a strong team of reliable and responsible people whose daily work also creates the IT conditions for a stable euro and other central bank tasks. Join us on the road to a digital central bank Team leader in the area of data science services Work location: Frankfurt am Main Employment: Full-time (part-time is possible in principle), permanent Hiring date as soon as possible Job ID: 2023_0668_02 Job Scope The "Data Lab" provides data science services for process automation, data provisioning, and data analysis and forecasting around master and cross-sectional data. Work of special value: your assignment with us Personnel and technical management as well as strategic control of our "Data Lab", currently consisting of 6 employees. Conceptual... and technical development of work processes and IT procedures. Steering the development of machine learning algorithms in the application areas of data quality management, record linkage and consolidation procedures with the aim of achieving the highest possible degree of automation while ensuring the required data quality. Representation of the Bundesbank in international and national working groups and data science networks. Special Values: Your qualifications Accredited Master's degree or equivalent in mathematics, statistics or (business) computer science. Very good knowledge of mathematical-statistical methods as well as econometric methods. Application experience in data science and artificial intelligence as well as database management, machine learning and record linkage. Very good programming skills (e.g., Python) as well as very good version control skills (e.g., Git, GitLab) Experience with agile ways of working (e.g. Scrum). Strong leadership skills coupled with analytical and conceptual skills as well as the ability to present complex issues in an understandable way High willingness to take responsibility as well as the ability to competently represent the bank (internally and externally) Very good communication skills in German and English language Valuable work deserves special benefits Remuneration & Prospects Remuneration based on the TVöD on the basis of pay group E 14, plus bank allowance, additional pension plan, future-oriented workplace in the public sector with reliable working conditions, permanent employment contract, international working environment, basic possibility of civil service, possibility of continuing an existing civil service relationship (up to A 15), national and international exchange opportunities. New Work Home office opportunities, good technical equipment (e.g. smartphone, tablet, notebook), working hours: 39 hours/week, 30 days vacation, promotion of work-life balance/family compatibility Additional benefits company health management, health and sports courses, company restaurant, free job ticket, central location. Do you want to enrich our team? Then we are already very excited about your application. If you have any questions in advance, just get in touch with the relevant contact person. Your questions about the application Marco Rondinella 069 9566-34012 jobsbundesbank.de Your questions about the job Florian Fischer 069 9566-37056 Please apply by 13/08/2023 with job ID 2023_0668_02 via our online tool. Diversity and equal opportunities are important to us. Severely disabled people will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified. The Deutsche Bundesbank also promotes professional equality between women and men, particularly when filling management positions. We therefore particularly welcome applications from women. You are most welcome to us in all your individuality We look forward to getting to know you better with your application. For more information about Bundesbank as an employer, please visit www.bundesbank.de/karriere. Deutsche Bundesbank | Wilhelm-Epstein-Strasse 14 | 60431 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

title: Data Scientist (w/m/d)
description:
Wir suchen für die Raiffeisen Analytik GmbH Mitgestalter:innen, die die Raiffeisenlandesbank Niederösterreich-Wien als unseren wichtigsten Auftraggeber in die digitale Zukunft begleiten. Wir konzipieren und entwickeln Produkte und Services für den stationären Vertrieb und für unsere digitalen Kanälen. Werden Sie Teil dieses agilen Teams!

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir daher einen Data Scientist.

Data Scientist (w/m/d)

Wien, Anstellungsart: Vollzeit

IHRE AUFGABEN: MEHR BEWEGEN

Wie Ihr Arbeitsalltag aussieht? Abwechslung statt Einheitsbrei.
• Entwickeln von kundenorientierten Analysemodelle (Customer Analytics)
• Implementieren von statistischen und mathematischen Methoden/Algorithmen mit Python und R
• Erweiterung von internen Daten-Modellen; Kenntnisse mit MS SQL-Server erforderlich
• Vorbereitung von Daten mit SQL, PL/SQL Kenntnisse wünschenswert
• Vorbereitung von statistischen Analysen und Visualisierungen
• Dokumentation der Modelle und Ergebnisse
• Kommunikation... von Ergebnissen an verschiedene Stakeholder, zB Management oder fachlich Verantwortliche

Unser Angebot: mehr erleben

Was uns ausmacht? Gemeinsam statt einsam.

Für diese Position bieten wir ein Jahresbruttogehalt von mindestens € 40.000,-, entsprechende Berufserfahrungen und Qualifikationen werden zusätzlich berücksichtigt. Darüber hinaus bieten wir ergänzende Benefits wie Mittagsessenzuschuss, Gesundheits- und Sportangebote, variable Arbeitszeiten.

IHR PROFIL: MEHR BEWIRKEN

Was wir uns wünschen? Ihren Einsatz für eine sichere Zukunft.
• Master oder PhD in einem MINT Fach
• Mind. 2-3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung in vergleichbarer Position, idealerweise im Bankenumfeld
• Erfahrung mit im Bereich Customer Analytics wünschenswert
• Erfahrungen im agilen Umfeld (optimaler Weise Scrum) wünschenswert
• Methodisches, genaues und effizientes Arbeit
• Fundierte analytische Fähigkeiten, aber gleichzeitig praktische, problemlösende Einstellung erforderlich
• Fähigkeit, mit einem nicht-technischen Publikum zu kommunizieren, einschließlich Verhandlungen mit internen und externen Parteien
• Teamplayer, hoher Einsatz, Belastungsfähigkeit, unabhängiger Arbeitsstil

title: Data scientist
description:
Data Science, Datenanalyse, Python, Programmiersprachen, Datenanalytik Hannover Re - 3,500 employees at 170 locations worldwide.
Our strength? Connecting Power:
We rely on each other.
As a reinsurer, we protect our clients in the event of a loss.
This requires tailor-made, innovative solutions.
Solutions that were right yesterday may be outdated tomorrow.
We challenge ourselves and continuously optimize our services, consulting and products.
All this makes us one of the leading and most profitable reinsurance groups in the world and a reliable employer.
Join our department Latin America, Iberian Peninsula at our Hannover location on a full-time, permanent basis as soon as possible as Data Scientist:
in with underwriting skills for the Latin American market.
Your tasks Join our team and create computational tools to automate underwriting processes, thus increasing efficiency in this area.
Design computational tools to achieve results using mathematical models applied to data... sets.
Interpretation of data, analysis of results using statistical techniques.
Data analysis with a focus on reinsurance results Analysis of reinsurance requests from our clients including risk assessment.
Preparation and execution of quotations and underwriting decisions Maintaining, developing and building sustainable customer relationships.
Your profile Master's degree in data analytics or economics with a quantitative focus or (business) mathematics.
Knowledge of a higher level programming language, e.g.
R or Python Ideally, experience in the insurance sector, e.g., in the support of corporate clients or in actuarial services Reference to Latin America Spanish or Portuguese at native level (C2), English at business fluent level (at least C1).
Willingness to travel worldwide, circa two to three times a year.
Personally, you convince with your strong analytical thinking skills and your solution-oriented approach.
If you also bring a team-oriented work style and have a high motivation and strong communication skills, you are exactly right with us! Our offer Atmosphere:
With us, you will encounter an international working environment with short decision-making paths, an open feedback culture and a togetherness that is characterized by appreciation and helpfulness.
Performance:
A structured induction, flexible working hours, benefits above the standard pay scale as well as contemporary offers for personal development, health management and work-life balance are just some of our benefits.
Perspective:
You bring your technical and methodological expertise with you and we offer you new impulses and the opportunity to further develop your potential.
Room for innovative ideas and their implementation included! If you too would like to work differently with certainty, apply simply and securely via our application portal, quoting the reference number 1161.
You can find out more about our working environment, your entry options and development opportunities at hannover-rueck.de/karriere.
hannover-rueck.jobs

title: (Junior) Data Science Consultant (all genders)
description:
Das erwartet dich
• Setze deinen analytischen Verstand und dein kreatives Denken gezielt ein, um die nächste Generation von Data Science Projekten für unsere Kunden zu entwickeln.
• Als Teil eines interdisziplinären Teams fokussierst du dich darauf, Verbesserungspotenziale zu identifizieren sowie Analysestrategien, Betriebsmodelle und Wertearchitekturen zu entwickeln, um die bereits vorhandenen Daten zu monetarisieren.
• Im Fokus steht die Identifikation, Design, Erprobung, Industrialisierung und Skalierung von datengetriebenen Anwendungsfällen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden.
• Dabei stehst du mit den Entscheidungsträgern auf Kundenseite im engen Kontakt und sorgst dafür, dass die erarbeiteten Analytics-Lösungen in realen Umgebungen erfolgreich implementiert werden

title: (Jr) Quantitative Analyst / Data Scientist
description:
Company Overview:

TrueChoice Solutions is a privately held, rapidly growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company and is the leader in real-time preference analytics, headquartered in New York. We develop and deploy unique, sophisticated applications in marketing, sales and HR that give our clients insights about “how” and “why” customers and employees make decisions and what they value. Used by many forward-thinking FORTUNE Global 1000 clients, the TrueChoice™ Predictive Selling Suite is based on patented econometric technologies that for the first time allow companies to precisely quantify the preference structures of individual customers and employees in real time. Our clients use these insights to help increase sales, retention, and profitability. TrueChoice has strong partnerships with 6 of the world’s top 10 consulting firms. Our client base is diverse and includes large automotive companies to consumer electronics manufacturers and health care services companies. We have teams... in Continental Europa, New York and Singapore.

‍

Position Overview:

TrueChoice Solutions is currently seeking a qualified candidate to fill the role of (Jr) Quantitative Analyst / Data Scientist within our growing organization. We are looking for a smart, inquisitive, and creative self-starter with a strong analytical and data science skillset and ideally with first experience in business analysis, consulting or project management. This is an exciting opportunity for a junior quantitative analyst / data scientist to be actively involved across projects and client work and take up more tasks and responsibilities as you grow your skillset.

Duties & Responsibilities:
• Support the organization on all projects and tasks related to analytics, quantitative analyses and data science
• Develop client-facing analytics dashboards
• Execute various qualitative and quantitative business analysis tasks including data analysis, research and modeling
• Collaborate across teams, senior management, business partners and clients at multiple projects simultaneously during research design, analytics and insights presentations
• Contribute to workshops for project scoping and research requirements
• Consult with clients on their strategic and business needs

Position Requirements
• Bachelor's degree or higher in business, computer science, engineering, economics, mathematics, social sciences or related field with first (1+ year) experience and/or excellent university grades.
• Experience with reporting and dashboard tools such as Spotfire, R Shiny, PowerBI, Tableau
• Experience with SQL, R, Python. Experience with C# is an advantage
• Experience with AI and Machine Learning
• Strong analytical skills, preferably with experience in econometrics and/or conjoint analysis
• Facility with enterprise software such as CRM Dynamics is an advantage
• Evidence of an analytical mindset and solid business analysis capabilities
• Aptitude for analytical & creative thinking and problem-solving; intellectually curious
• Strong interpersonal, knowledge sharing, and written and oral communication skills

Benefits

Compensation:

We offer a competitive salary, generous benefits and flexible compensation with a cashbonus and stock options.

Preferred Location:

Anywhere, remote allowed. Preferably near Vienna (Austria), near New York or near Singapore

How to Apply:
Please send resumes to
jobs@truechoice.io citing " (Jr) Quantitative Analyst / Data Scientist" in the subject line

description: (Senior) Data Scientist/Engineer (m/w/d) Merken Merken Meine Aufgaben Erstellen von Data Pipelines für maschinelles Lernen.Aufbau von Recommendation Engines mit der Google Cloud Platform (GCP).Testen und laufende Optimierung von Machine Learning Modellen.Cloud Komponenten programmieren und deren Kommunikation zu den Drittsystemen gewährleisten. Selbstverständlich ist die Bereitschaft zu Überzahlung abhängig von Berufserfahrung und Qualifikation gegeben']}]

title: Data scientist (f/m/d) Maternity leave replacement, fixed term...
description:
This is what you can expect

– You are responsible for data preparation and data blending using various programming languages for our technical and main departments.

– You will provide support with drawing up statistical models for Wiener Linien data, will develop various KPIs and develop these further.

– You will design and develop machine learning algorithms.

– You will work on creating complex analyses for new, system-optimised processes and modelling and assist with forecasts.

– You will generate business value for Wiener Linien based on complex data problems.

– You will be responsible for visualisation, preparation and presentation of data insights.

This is what you will contribute

– Ideally you will have completed a leaving certificate („Matura“) at a polytechnic or a technical degree in the field of data science, mathematics, IT or similar.

– You have relevant experience in the commercial use of advanced analytics, machine learning and statistical modelling.

– You have... very good mathematical and statistical knowledge and wide-ranging awareness of IT and big data technologies.

– You have advanced programming knowledge of the script languages Python, SQL, R or similar. Ideally, you will already have successfully completed data science projects.

– You are skilled at preparing, processing and visualising data and creating dashboards (Qlik, MS Power BI, Tableau or similar).

We keep Vienna running day-to-day and accept responsibility for the people in this city – including for their health. To protect our colleagues and customers, we therefore prefer applicants who have already been vaccinated against Covid-19 or who are willing to be vaccinated

title: Data Alignment Lead
description:
Join us on our exciting journey!

IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, Technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

Job Description

The purpose of the Site Payments Lead (Data Team) role is to deliver accurate data for site payments, spanning multiple IQVIA proprietary systems, and improve process efficiencies. The employee will ideally be a Subject Matter Expert in proprietary systems required for payment generation. They must have end-to-end understanding of the data flows and system handoffs. They will be a point of contact for IT groups and Payments groups.

Responsibilities:
• Deliver accurate site payment data for all IQVIA studies, regardless of system used for payment (IQVIA CTMS or DrugDev).
•... Identify opportunities & scope requirements for new tools & processes that allow data check process scale up
• Define & implement a best practice approach for data that can be rolled out globally for all IQVIA payment studies
• Resolve data flows on large, ongoing projects. Project manage stakeholders involved in the process. Manage the migration of these projects into centralised IQVIA payment processes (CTMS and DrugDev)
• Stakeholder manage & project manage team members from 5 different internal IQVIA groups. Understand their processes and how to effect change
• Directly resolve EDC, Data Warehouse, CTMS or DrugDev system issues that are preventing payments

Our Ideal Candidate Will Have:
• 3-5 years’ experience & significant working knowledge of IQVIA subject visit data flow systems: EDC, Data Warehouse (Data Factory), CTMS, DrugDev
• 3-5 years’ experience within a CRO site payments process. Significant experience across all aspects of the payment lifecycle: data setup, contract setup, system setup, payment generation, site-facing experience
• Intermediate to advanced Excel skills with understanding/ability of writing logic statements
• Ability to communicate complex project plans upwards with a simple messaging
• Extremely process oriented – ability to step methodically through a business process or system process, and understand what is broken, the root cause, the corrective action and the preventative action
• Drives change in processes, for the right reasons & rationale. Sets a fast pace and has a sense of urgency
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with confidence attending and hosting calls
• Exceptional ability to communicate & train others remotely (via teleconferencing)

We know that meaningful results require not only the right approach but also the right people. Regardless of your role, we invite you to reimagine healthcare with us. You will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and

Whatever your career goals, we are here to ensure you get there!

We invite you to join IQVIA™.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

title: Data Scientist ( Senior )
description:
We are a young consulting company with a team of talented data engineers, architects and data scientists specializing in building cloud-based data platforms and AI/ML solutions for our customers. Our customers, with which we have strong relationships and multi-year contracts, include well-known companies in the areas of energy providers & utilities, retail, financial services, and mobile apps. Our projects always involve applying cutting-edge cloud technologies to exciting real-world data. This is shown by our strong relationship with Microsoft where we have multiple Gold- and Advanced Certifications.

One extremely important aspect of the work at paiqo is our culture – having fun working together, trusting each other, and combining independence with teamwork. There are no fixed working hours and no fixed reporting structure. We are looking for Data Engineers who we can trust to do great work on their projects because they are motivated by the challenging nature of the projects... themselves. We are also looking for people who we can learn from and who are willing to learn with us, to always stay on the cutting edge with our technical skills.

Your tasks in a project could be
• Interacting with the customer and understanding his business needs and processes
• Use case reflection together with the customer to find the best use case to apply Data Science / Machine Learning
• Analyzing and understanding the provided data and connecting it to the business processes
• Implementing a machine learning model (whichever model fits best; e.g. in python) which improves the business processes
• Presentation of results and discussion of machine learning model internally and with the customer
• Deployment of the found model in customer's business processes (on-Prem or in cloud)

What we offer
• Challenging projects with well-known companies in various fields
• Young and highly motivated team
• Great emphasis on education and trainings with dedicated time on the job
• Mentoring and guidance from senior colleagues
• Opportunity to use the newest technologies around Data Science
• Home office
• Flexible working hours
• Good analytical and problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and an ability to explore and understand customers’ technical ecosystems and data, as well as an ability to communicate complex technical problems and their solutions clearly
• Experience in the Python and/or R Data Science ecosystems
• Interest in working with visualization tools (PowerBI, etc.)
• Interest in modern cloud-based data architecture and cloud services
• Interest in working with Spark and the Hadoop stack
• Readiness to travel
• German and English fluently spoken and written
• Deep understanding of the overall Data Science workflow including the most common algorithms
• Experience in working with various databases (SQL and NoSQL)
• 5+ years of experience in a similar role
• Ability to handle the full data science lifecycle from conception to deployment

title: Job in Germany: Team Leader in Data Science Services (m/f/d...
description: The Deutsche Bundesbank is a special bank: an integral part of the European System of Central Banks with an important function in financial stability, banking supervision, monetary policy and payment transactions in Germany. Above all, however, we are a strong team of reliable and responsible people whose daily work also creates the IT conditions for a stable euro and other central bank tasks. Join us on the road to a digital central bank Team leader in the area of data science services Work location: Frankfurt am Main Employment: Full-time (part-time is possible in principle), permanent Hiring date as soon as possible Job ID: 2023_0668_02 Job Scope The "Data Lab" provides data science services for process automation, data provisioning, and data analysis and forecasting around master and cross-sectional data. Work of special value: your assignment with us Personnel and technical management as well as strategic control of our "Data Lab", currently consisting of 6 employees. Conceptual... and technical development of work processes and IT procedures. Steering the development of machine learning algorithms in the application areas of data quality management, record linkage and consolidation procedures with the aim of achieving the highest possible degree of automation while ensuring the required data quality. Representation of the Bundesbank in international and national working groups and data science networks. Special Values: Your qualifications Accredited Master's degree or equivalent in mathematics, statistics or (business) computer science. Very good knowledge of mathematical-statistical methods as well as econometric methods. Application experience in data science and artificial intelligence as well as database management, machine learning and record linkage. Very good programming skills (e.g., Python) as well as very good version control skills (e.g., Git, GitLab) Experience with agile ways of working (e.g. Scrum). Strong leadership skills coupled with analytical and conceptual skills as well as the ability to present complex issues in an understandable way High willingness to take responsibility as well as the ability to competently represent the bank (internally and externally) Very good communication skills in German and English language Valuable work deserves special benefits Remuneration & Prospects Remuneration based on the TVöD on the basis of pay group E 14, plus bank allowance, additional pension plan, future-oriented workplace in the public sector with reliable working conditions, permanent employment contract, international working environment, basic possibility of civil service, possibility of continuing an existing civil service relationship (up to A 15), national and international exchange opportunities. New Work Home office opportunities, good technical equipment (e.g. smartphone, tablet, notebook), working hours: 39 hours/week, 30 days vacation, promotion of work-life balance/family compatibility Additional benefits company health management, health and sports courses, company restaurant, free job ticket, central location. Do you want to enrich our team? Then we are already very excited about your application. If you have any questions in advance, just get in touch with the relevant contact person. Your questions about the application Marco Rondinella 069 9566-34012 jobsbundesbank.de Your questions about the job Florian Fischer 069 9566-37056 Please apply by 13/08/2023 with job ID 2023_0668_02 via our online tool. Diversity and equal opportunities are important to us. Severely disabled people will be given preferential consideration if they are equally qualified. The Deutsche Bundesbank also promotes professional equality between women and men, particularly when filling management positions. We therefore particularly welcome applications from women. You are most welcome to us in all your individuality We look forward to getting to know you better with your application. For more information about Bundesbank as an employer, please visit www.bundesbank.de/karriere. Deutsche Bundesbank | Wilhelm-Epstein-Strasse 14 | 60431 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

title: Marketing Strategy and Data Analyst Intern
description: Who we are Bitpanda simplifies wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, Bitpanda exists to help people trust themselves enough to build financial freedom for their future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks, precious metals and commodities they want — all possible with any sized budget, 24/7. With more than 700 team members and more than 4 million customers, our company is one of Europe's most successful fintechs. Headquartered in Austria but operating across all of Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people who represent more than 50 nationalities. If you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!Your mission As a Marketing... Strategy and Data Analyst intern at Bitpanda, you will be supporting the Commercial Strategy and Operations team with the completion of day-to-day tasks. These include data analysis and preparation of different campaigns, reporting on performance metrics and management of ongoing projects. What you’ll do Bring together, explore and analyse large scale datasets to find actionable marketing insights Provide a better understanding of customers, their user characteristics and how they use our products Collaborate across multiple teams and departments to help support a data-driven marketing team Create interactive reports and dashboards to solve specific needs and empower key stakeholders Extract key insights and lessons from post-campaign performance data to shape upcoming product launches and marketing campaigns Who you are A data enthusiast who can translate complex topics into simple and actionable insights Relevant experience in marketing analytics, consumer insights and/or business analysis. Excellent data visualisation skills with expertise in tools such as Tableau and Excel. Strong SQL skills and familiarity with Snowflake. Detail orientation, proactivity, strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills. Fluency in English. What’s in it for you Competitive total compensation package including participation in our stock option plan Market-leading Flex-Ben approach and package (see our careers page) Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda Occasional company-wide and team events - both in-person and virtually! Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand A diverse team of fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people who are united (across cultures and time zones) by our unique way of working And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform. Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills

title: Data Scientist in der Biopharmazie / Operations (w/m/d) Teilzeit...
company_name: Boehringer Ingelheim RCV GmbH & Co KG
description:
﻿
Data Scientist in der Biopharmazie / Operations (w/m/d) Teilzeit 20h/Woche

1120 Meidling

Job ID 2139

Unser Unternehmen

Bei Boehringer Ingelheim entwickeln wir bahnbrechende Therapien, die das Leben von Mensch und Tier verbessern. Als 1885 gegründetes und seitdem im Familienbesitz befindliches Unternehmen nehmen wir eine langfristige Perspektive ein. Mit 52.000 Mitarbeitenden weltweit setzen wir unsere Ziele um und fördern dabei eine vielfältige, gemeinschaftliche und inklusive Unternehmenskultur. Wir sind überzeugt: Mit talentierten und ambitionierten Mitarbeitenden und ihrer Leidenschaft für Innovationen heben wir die Grenzen des Erreichbaren immer wieder auf.

Die Stelle

Sie lieben Daten und wollen biopharmazeutische Prozesse transparent machen?
Die Produktionsprozesse erzeugen eine Vielzahl Daten, die Auskunft über den Status des entstehenden Produktes liefern. Wir suchen ab sofort einen Data Scientist, der unser Team mit der Aufbereitung und Interpretation dieser Daten... unterstützt.
Aufgaben und Zuständigkeiten
• Ansprechpartner für Engineers und Scientists zu Data Science Fragestellungen sowie Unterstützung bei der Auswertung
• Fachliche Konzeption von Benutzeranforderungen aus den Fachbereichen und Zusammenarbeit mit der IT -Abteilung bei Priorisierung und Umsetzung
• Mitarbeit bei Digitalisierungsprojekten und Verantwortung für einzelne Workstreams (z.B. ETL-Prozesse, Data Warehouses, Datenauswertungen, Machine Learning etc.) in Zusammenarbeit mit der IT-Abteilung
• Implementierung von Datenbankanbindungen oder Erstellung von Datenauswertungen und Reports durch Business Intelligence Selfservice Tools (z.B. Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI etc.)

Anforderungen
• Abgeschlossenes technisches/naturwissenschaftliches Studium (Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Biotechnologie, Engineering, …)
• Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Position, idealerweise im pharmazeutischen Umfeld (GMP Erfahrung von Vorteil)
• Sicherer Umgang mit großen Datenmengen aus verschiedenen Datenquellen
• Erfahrung mit Programmier- und Datenbanksprachen wie z.B. Python, R, SQL
• Verständnis/Erfahrung von Datenbanktechnologien (z.B. PostgreSQL, AWS, OpenShift etc.)
• Gute Kenntnisse von Visualisierungs- oder Dashboarding-Tools (z.B. Tableau, Spotfire, Jupyter Notebooks, Streamlit, R-Shiny etc.)
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Ihre Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle/Home-Office je nach Bereich und Position
• Eingearbeitete Fenstertage für mehr Freizeit
• Betriebsrestaurant mit abwechslungsreichem Mittagsangebot für Ihr tägliches Wohlbefinden
• Positionsspezifische Aus- & Weiterbildung, damit wir langfristig gemeinsam wachsen können
• Umfassende Gesundheitsförderung, um Ihre Gesundheit bestmöglich zu unterstützen

Das Mindestgrundentgelt gemäß Einstufung nach Kollektivvertrag liegt für diese Position bei € 43.548,40 brutto pro Jahr (Vollzeit). Das tatsächliche Gehalt orientiert sich an branchenüblichen Gehältern, Ihren individuellen Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen.
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung!

Bitte laden Sie Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen direkt über unser Bewerbungsportal hoch, damit wir Ihre Daten DSGVO-konform und vertraulich behandeln können.

Haben Sie noch zusätzliche Fragen? Ihre HR Recruiting Managerin für diese Position ist Sabine Huebmer.

Auf unserer Karriereseite finden Sie weitere Informationen über uns als Arbeitgeber sowie zum Bewerbungsprozess. Werfen Sie auch einen Blick hinter die Kulissen und erhalten Sie Einblicke in unseren Unternehmensalltag.

Jetzt bewerben

Wir sind überzeugt: Mit talentierten und ambitionierten Mitarbeitenden und ihrer Leidenschaft für Innovationen heben wir die Grenzen des Erreichbaren immer wieder auf.

Die Stelle

Sie lieben Daten und wollen biopharmazeutische Prozesse transparent machen?
Die Produktionsprozesse erzeugen eine Vielzahl Daten, die Auskunft über den Status des entstehenden Produktes liefern. Wir suchen ab sofort einen Data Scientist, der unser Team mit der Aufbereitung und Interpretation dieser Daten... unterstützt.
Aufgaben und Zuständigkeiten
• Ansprechpartner für Engineers und Scientists zu Data Science Fragestellungen sowie Unterstützung bei der Auswertung
• Fachliche Konzeption von Benutzeranforderungen aus den Fachbereichen und Zusammenarbeit mit der IT -Abteilung bei Priorisierung und Umsetzung
• Mitarbeit bei Digitalisierungsprojekten und Verantwortung für einzelne Workstreams (z.B. ETL-Prozesse, Data Warehouses, Datenauswertungen, Machine Learning etc.) in Zusammenarbeit mit der IT-Abteilung
• Implementierung von Datenbankanbindungen oder Erstellung von Datenauswertungen und Reports durch Business Intelligence Selfservice Tools (z.B. Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI etc.)

Anforderungen
• Abgeschlossenes technisches/naturwissenschaftliches Studium (Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Biotechnologie, Engineering, …)
• Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Position, idealerweise im pharmazeutischen Umfeld (GMP Erfahrung von Vorteil)
• Sicherer Umgang mit großen Datenmengen aus verschiedenen Datenquellen
• Erfahrung mit Programmier- und Datenbanksprachen wie z.B. Python, R, SQL
• Verständnis/Erfahrung von Datenbanktechnologien (z.B. PostgreSQL, AWS, OpenShift etc.)
• Gute Kenntnisse von Visualisierungs- oder Dashboarding-Tools (z.B. Tableau, Spotfire, Jupyter Notebooks, Streamlit, R-Shiny etc.)
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Ihre Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle/Home-Office je nach Bereich und Position
• Eingearbeitete Fenstertage für mehr Freizeit
• Betriebsrestaurant mit abwechslungsreichem Mittagsangebot für Ihr tägliches Wohlbefinden
• Positionsspezifische Aus- & Weiterbildung, damit wir langfristig gemeinsam wachsen können
• Umfassende Gesundheitsförderung, um Ihre Gesundheit bestmöglich zu unterstützen

Das Mindestgrundentgelt gemäß Einstufung nach Kollektivvertrag liegt für diese Position bei € 43.548,40 brutto pro Jahr (Vollzeit). Das tatsächliche Gehalt orientiert sich an branchenüblichen Gehältern, Ihren individuellen Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen.
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung!

Bitte laden Sie Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen direkt über unser Bewerbungsportal hoch, damit wir Ihre Daten DSGVO-konform und vertraulich behandeln können.

Haben Sie noch zusätzliche Fragen? Ihre HR Recruiting Managerin für diese Position ist Sabine Huebmer.

Auf unserer Karriereseite finden Sie weitere Informationen über uns als Arbeitgeber sowie zum Bewerbungsprozess. Werfen Sie auch einen Blick hinter die Kulissen und erhalten Sie Einblicke in unseren Unternehmensalltag.

Jetzt bewerben']}]

title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
description:
Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)

We at the Advanced Analytics & AI tribe take care that innovation is done right within RBI group. Our team has already delivered numerous successes in this area. We are agile, creative and have a hands-on mentality. And we are looking for like-minded people to join us.

Do you want to combine the enthusiasm and flexibility of a start-up with the solid background of an established bank? Are you energetic, enthusiastic & passionate to apply creative approaches and techniques with data, which plays the most important role in a modern bank? Do you want to work with the state-of-the-art cloud infrastructure (Databricks on AWS)? Are you ready to shape the future of the financial industry within Central and Eastern Europe? Then you are the right person for our team!

#full-time

(38.5h / week)

#viennaoffice

(1190)

#homeoffice

possible

Your role at RBI
• You execute a wide range of use cases across all business lines, prove hypotheses and bring in your own... ideas
• You predict customer behavior, conversion probabilities, churn rates, define target groups, detect suspicious transactions supported by Machine Learning
• You translate data analysis findings and research results into concrete actions
• You visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats
• You be the missing link between business experts, IT and Advanced Analytics & AI
• You teach and train more junior colleagues in data science to further develop these capabilities across RBI

Your core competencies
• You have worked in the field of Data Science in a large corporation for about 5 years
• You have profound knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques
• You come with good scripting skills (Python or R) and knowledge of most popular machine learning libraries
• You have a strong track record of successfully delivering data products, services or insights where you had to understand complex data flows and business processes
• You are fluent in English; German is appreciated, but not mandatory
• You have the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively and comprehensively and you can stand criticism without losing your smile

Nice to have
• Experience in financial services is a strong plus

What's in it for you
• Work Life Balance : f lexible working hours (no core time) & extensive hybrid working possibilities
• Meaningful Career Options : to develop personally & professionally
• Learning : as part of our DNA & culture
• Easy Moving : work permit support
• Easy Commuting : free public transport pass
• Canteen : healthy, tasty, and heavily subsidized
• Leisure time activities : attractive sports and cultural offers (free museum tickets, reduced gym membership, etc.)
• Saving : with vouchers / discounts from our staffs' council (eg. for supermarkets)
• Free : Salary account and credit card
• Family Friendly : family allowances, gender-neutral parental leave, part-time work, bilingual company kindergarten etc.
• Salary : starting at EUR 60.000,- gross p.a . including overtime (market-compliant overpayment is provided dep. on experience / qualification)

At Raiffeisen Bank International , we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries – what got us here, are our talented people . From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website or check out our FAQ . If you have any other questions, feel free to contact XX (optional) OR Please address your application letter to XX (optional).

Follow us on our RBI Account on
LinkedIn

title: Data Scientist w/m/d
description:
AVL ist eines der weltweit führenden Mobilitäts-Technologieunternehmen für Entwicklung, Simulation und Testen in der Automobilindustrie und in anderen Branchen. Das Unternehmen liefert Konzepte, Lösungen und Methoden in Bereichen wie Fahrzeugentwicklung und -integration, E-Mobilität, Fahrerassistenzsysteme und autonomes Fahren (ADAS/AD) und Software für eine grüne, sichere und bessere Welt der Mobilität.

Aufgaben

Als erfahrener und engagierter Data Scientist (m/w/d) unterstützen Sie unser IT-Team im Zentralbereich dabei, komplexe Datenherausforderungen zu bewältigen und wertvolle Erkenntnisse aus unseren Daten zu gewinnen. In dieser Rolle arbeiten Sie eng mit anderen Datenexperten, Ingenieuren und Fachexperten zusammen, um datenbasierte Lösungen zu entwickeln. Ihre künftige Abteilung ist dabei Ansprechpartner für alle Themen rund um Software Development, Database Development sowie Software Architecture für die zentralen Funktionen der AVL.
• Eigenverantwortliche Durchführung von... Prozess- und Umfelddaten Analysen
• Konzeption und Entwicklung von Machine Learning Modellen
• Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit mit Software-Developer, Data Engineers und IT-Consultants
• Konzeption, Automatisierung und Umsetzung von skalierbaren Datenverarbeitungspipelines und deren Monitoring
• Datenvisualisierung und aussagekräftige Berichterstattung komplexer und Analysenergebnisse

Profil
• Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Mathematik, Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften mit dem Schwerpunkt Statistik oder Data Science
• Zumindest 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Scientist oder Data Engineer
• Erfahrung mit AI/ML in Cloud oder OnPremise Systemen
• Sehr gute Python und/oder R Kenntnisse
• Sicherer Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken und Datenmodellierungen
• Fundiertes Wissen im Bereich Big Data, Datenanalyse sowie Datenspeicherungssysteme (SQL/,NoSQL Database, Data Lake, Datawarehouse)
• Ausgeprägte Kommunikationskompetenz inkl. der Fähigkeit komplexe statistische Daten und Konzepte zu visualisieren
• Teamfähigkeit und ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen
• Fließende Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten

Jahresbezug: Aufgrund des österreichischen Gleichbehandlungsgesetzes sind wir verpflichtet, den für diese Position vorgesehenen Jahresbezug (Vollzeit) als Verhandlungsbasis anzugeben: €55,000.00 brutto. Die Einstufung erfolgt lt. Kollektivvertrag für Angestellte der Industrie (Fachverband Fahrzeugindustrie). Wir bieten aber auf jeden Fall eine marktkonforme Bezahlung in Abhängigkeit von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung.

Interessiert?
Dann nutzen Sie unser Online-Bewerbungstool um Ihre Bewerbung an AVL zu senden.

Gehalt: 55000 EUR / YEAR

title: Spatial data scientist
company_name: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA)
description:
Deadline: until filled

41-2023

Spatial data scientist

INTEGRATED BIOSPHERE FUTURES (IBF) RESEARCH GROUP

The IBF Research Group, part of the IIASA Biodiversity and Natural Resources (BNR) Program, is offering an opportunity for a spatial data scientist who will work on processing and analyzing land-use, land management and international trade related large datasets.

BACKGROUND

The IBF Research Group adopts an integrated approach to sustainable land use and ecosystems modeling taking into account i) interactions between different economic sectors, including agriculture, forestry, bioenergy, and fisheries, ii) synergies and trade-offs between multiple societal objectives, including, but not limited to, GHG emissions and climate change mitigation, climate change impacts and adaptation, food security, sustainable nutrient and water management, and biodiversity, iii) across different spatial and temporal scales, going from pixel through the country level up to the global scale, and... from annual to a hundred year time horizon.

The group is strongly connected to the international academic community, placing emphasis on transdisciplinary synergies, and applied approaches. The work accomplished has long been recognized through regular publications in high-ranking scientific journals, and the BNR Program includes several Top 1% highly cited researchers. In addition, BNR is recognized as a reliable partner in support of national policy making and international multilateral processes.

THE POSITION

The modeling efforts within BNR/IBF rely on large spatial datasets and databases. In current Horizon Europe projects these are to be updated and extended in terms of their spatial and thematic resolution. This requires the processing and harmonization of raster and shapefile data, ensuring their consistency. Moreover, future high-resolution projections of land-use and other key agricultural variables are a key product of the IBF group’s modeling efforts. Producing these requires considerable expertise in applied spatial data science.

The spatial data scientist will be responsible for the design and development of databases, analyzing large datasets, and developing a data ecosystem around existing models within BNR/IBF. Data to be integrated can be as diverse as agricultural market accounts, spatial land, and crop cover dataset, GHG emission inventories, land use change timeseries in long term scenarios. Additionally, the successful candidate will statistical and machine learning algorithms to identify correlations and trends in the data and perform quality control of data. This role requires a high degree of technical skill, analytical thinking, and the ability to communicate complex data and insights to a variety of researchers.

MAIN TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Collect and process large spatial datasets and design the database architecture around the GLOBIOM and downscalR models, including linkages to other IBF/BNR models.

Develop, maintain, and document official database processing streams to models, including for spatial datasets, and supervise their consistent integration into the models.

Develop tools for performing quality control of data sources and databases being used for model activities.

Develop automated tests and routines to ease data sharing among and across partners and projects.

Analyze and interpret data and model projections using statistical and mathematical methods, tests, and data mining algorithms.

Produce reports and presentations to communicate results.

Troubleshoot and resolve data issues.

Provide technical support and training to other team members.

In line with the team spirit that prevails at IIASA, the incumbent may occasionally work on other tasks assigned by their superiors, that might not be directly related to this appointment but where the post holder has relevant experience and skills, and/or a shortage of immediate personnel capabilities requires such.

REQUIREMENTS

PhD degree, or master’s degree with relevant experience, in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, economics, environmental sciences or computer science.

Proficiency in R or Python programming languages.

Knowledge of statistical and mathematical methods.

Experience with GIS and big data processing desirable.

Experience with integrating data workflows into online applications is an asset.

A strong interest in land use and environmental science and familiarity with relevant datasets is an asset.

Experience with time series analysis.

Excellent command of English, both in spoken and written form.

Ability to work well both independently as well as part of a team.

IIASA offers an interdisciplinary and international workplace, and the possibility to interact with researchers of different nationalities, with strong ties to a world-wide network of research institutions engaged in environmental systems research. The successful candidate must be able to work in, and have respect for, an intercultural environment, and IIASA core values.

APPOINTMENT TERMS

The selected candidate should be available to take up the position as soon as possible in 2023. We offer an initial fixed-term, two-year, full-time (40 hours per week) employment contract, with the possibility of extension thereafter. Eligible applicants wishing to work part-time hours may be considered.

Duties will be carried out at the IIASA premises in Laxenburg, near Vienna in Austria.

The successful candidate will be appointed in accordance with the IIASA profiles for research careers.

WE OFFER

An international atmosphere and pleasant working environment in a historic market town surrounded by green areas.

The possibility to contribute to environmental sciences for sustainability and global wellbeing.

The opportunity to deepen and improve knowledge and scientific profile.

Career development perspectives.

An attractive salary which is exempt from income tax in Austria and negotiable, based on the qualifications, skills and experience of the selected individual and at least:

EUR 48,050.00 for R2 Research Scholars.

EUR 36,875.00 for R1 Researchers.

In addition, IIASA salaries are:

Subject to deductions for health insurance and/or social security.

Not directly comparable with other employers in Austria, due to the unique legal status and privileges granted to IIASA.

Subject to the principle of income aggregation (Progressionsvorbehalt in German).

OTHER BENEFITS

Educational subsidies for children of school age enrolled in private schools in Austria.

A generous annual leave entitlement.

Moving and settlement allowances and paid home leave for employees in scientific and professional categories hired from international locations.

The possibility to work up to 100 days per year in home office (within Austria)

Assistance for newcomers to Austria with visa, work and residency permit applications.

Support finding accommodation in Austria.

About IIASA

IIASA is committed to a working environment that promotes equality, diversity, tolerance and inclusion within its workforce. This is reflected in our IIASA core values. We encourage qualified candidates from all religious, ethnic, and social backgrounds to . In the case that candidates are equally qualified, preference will be given to applicants from countries where IIASA has a Member Organization.

Further Information

For further information about this opportunity please contact Michael Le Gohebel, BNR/IBF Program and Project Officer or Petr Havlik, BNR Program Director/IBF Research Group Leader.

For general information about working at IIASA, contact: recruitment@iiasa.ac.at

Applications

In order to for this opportunity, you will need to provide the following documents:

A cover letter outlining your motivation for and fit to the position

A detailed Curriculum Vitae

The names, addresses (including e-mail), and telephone numbers of two work-related reference givers.

Deadline for receipt of applications: until filled

In addition, IIASA salaries are:

Subject to deductions for health insurance and/or social security.

Not directly comparable with other employers in Austria, due to the unique legal status and privileges granted to IIASA.

Subject to the principle of income aggregation (Progressionsvorbehalt in German).

OTHER BENEFITS

Educational subsidies for children of school age enrolled in private schools in Austria.

A generous annual leave entitlement.

Moving and settlement allowances and paid home leave for employees in scientific and professional categories hired from international locations.

The possibility to work up to 100 days per year in home office (within Austria)

Assistance for newcomers to Austria with visa, work and residency permit applications.

Support finding accommodation in Austria.

About IIASA

IIASA is committed to a working environment that promotes equality, diversity, tolerance and inclusion within its workforce. This is reflected in our IIASA core values. We encourage qualified candidates from all religious, ethnic, and social backgrounds to . In the case that candidates are equally qualified, preference will be given to applicants from countries where IIASA has a Member Organization.

Further Information

For further information about this opportunity please contact Michael Le Gohebel, BNR/IBF Program and Project Officer or Petr Havlik, BNR Program Director/IBF Research Group Leader.

For general information about working at IIASA, contact: recruitment@iiasa.ac.at

Applications

In order to for this opportunity, you will need to provide the following documents:

A cover letter outlining your motivation for and fit to the position

A detailed Curriculum Vitae

The names, addresses (including e-mail), and telephone numbers of two work-related reference givers.

Deadline for receipt of applications: until filled']}]

title: Job in Germany: Medical Computer Scientist / Bioinformatician ...
description: Professional work in an exciting and modern environment: the University Hospital Düsseldorf Medical Services GmbH (UKM) is one of four wholly owned subsidiaries of the University Hospital Düsseldorf (UKD), the largest hospital in Düsseldorf. The activities in a maximum care hospital are diverse and interdisciplinary. We are responsible for essential areas of the daily operations of the UKD and stand as a guarantor for optimal care of secondary processes. This includes the areas of project management, construction & technology, laundry, central sterile supply, security service, UKM-IT, logistics, archive and much more. The University Hospital Düsseldorf Medical Services GmbH serves the UKD, among other things, in the area of IT services and supports the IT infrastructure of the hospital with a wide range of IT services. We would like to strengthen our team in the area of UKM IT in the long term and are looking for the next possible date a Medical Informatics Specialist / Bioinformatics... Specialist / Computer Scientist / Data Scientist (m/f/d). If you enjoy the following tasks Support research projects (including the Medical Informatics Initiative and NUM). Participation in the establishment of a data integration center Data extraction from primary clinical systems, design, implementation and monitoring of ETL processes. Integration of heterogeneous data, data harmonization, semantic data annotations and adoption of standard terminologies. And you bring the following Completed university studies (Master / Diploma) in the field of computer science / medical informatics / bioinformatics / data science or a comparable qualification for the above-mentioned area of responsibility. Knowledge of Linux, virtualization and containerization as well as current programming / scripting languages and Bash. Ideally, you have initial knowledge of terminologies such as LOINC, SNOMED-CT, of interface standards such as HL7, FHIR, XML, DICOM and experience with clinical systems such as HIS, PACS, LIS. Very good German and English language skills are an advantage An independent and structured working style Ability to work on complex problems in a goal- and solution-oriented manner Confident, competent and friendly appearance then we definitely want to meet you What you can expect from us: A varied, versatile and exciting field of activity in the environment of medical research Attractive remuneration according to application collective agreement TV-L up to EG 13, with 30 days of vacation, special payment, company pension plan, etc. Thorough familiarization and collegial support in a highly motivated team Possibility to work mobile with extensive equipment of modern hardware and software Room for personal responsibility, creativity and personal development Flexibly plannable and family-friendly working time models A whole catalog of diverse training opportunities for personal and professional development Attractive employee discounts (eg employee canteen, VRR, health promotion, corporate benefits & Gympass). Have we aroused your interest? We look forward to receiving your application documents, stating your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date - preferably by e-mail, in PDF format - to: ukm.bewerbungen[AT]med.uni-duesseldorf.de UK M University Hospital Düsseldorf Medical Services GmbH A subsidiary of the University Hospital Düsseldorf Building 11.75, 2nd floor, Human Resources Department, PF 812 Moorenstrasse 5, 40225 Düsseldorf https://www.uniklinik-duesseldorf.de/ukm Keyword: 230525 Medical / Bioinformatician / Data Scientist (m/f/d) (Please always indicate in the subject line) Severely disabled applicants will be given preferential consideration in case of equal suitability. The selection of personnel will take place with the responsible department of the UKD. Our data protection information: http://www.uniklinik-duesseldorf.de/ueber-das-ukd/unternehmen/tochtergesellschaften/ukm/datenschutz

title: Data Scientist w/m/d
via: via Vacancies For Col U Fans
description:
AVL ist eines der weltweit führenden Mobilitäts-Technologieunternehmen für Entwicklung, Simulation und Testen in der Automobilindustrie und in anderen Branchen. Das Unternehmen liefert Konzepte, Lösungen und Methoden in Bereichen wie Fahrzeugentwicklung und -integration, E-Mobilität, Fahrerassistenzsysteme und autonomes Fahren (ADAS/AD) und Software für eine grüne, sichere und bessere Welt der Mobilität.

Aufgaben

Als erfahrener und engagierter Data Scientist (m/w/d) unterstützen Sie unser IT-Team im Zentralbereich dabei, komplexe Datenherausforderungen zu bewältigen und wertvolle Erkenntnisse aus unseren Daten zu gewinnen. In dieser Rolle arbeiten Sie eng mit anderen Datenexperten, Ingenieuren und Fachexperten zusammen, um datenbasierte Lösungen zu entwickeln. Ihre künftige Abteilung ist dabei Ansprechpartner für alle Themen rund um Software Development, Database Development sowie Software Architecture für die zentralen Funktionen der AVL.
• Eigenverantwortliche Durchführung von... Prozess- und Umfelddaten Analysen
• Konzeption und Entwicklung von Machine Learning Modellen
• Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit mit Software-Developer, Data Engineers und IT-Consultants
• Konzeption, Automatisierung und Umsetzung von skalierbaren Datenverarbeitungspipelines und deren Monitoring
• Datenvisualisierung und aussagekräftige Berichterstattung komplexer und Analysenergebnisse

Profil
• Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Mathematik, Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften mit dem Schwerpunkt Statistik oder Data Science
• Zumindest 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Scientist oder Data Engineer
• Erfahrung mit AI/ML in Cloud oder OnPremise Systemen
• Sehr gute Python und/oder R Kenntnisse
• Sicherer Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken und Datenmodellierungen
• Fundiertes Wissen im Bereich Big Data, Datenanalyse sowie Datenspeicherungssysteme (SQL/,NoSQL Database, Data Lake, Datawarehouse)
• Ausgeprägte Kommunikationskompetenz inkl. der Fähigkeit komplexe statistische Daten und Konzepte zu visualisieren
• Teamfähigkeit und ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen
• Fließende Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten

Jahresbezug: Aufgrund des österreichischen Gleichbehandlungsgesetzes sind wir verpflichtet, den für diese Position vorgesehenen Jahresbezug (Vollzeit) als Verhandlungsbasis anzugeben: €55,000.00 brutto. Die Einstufung erfolgt lt. Kollektivvertrag für Angestellte der Industrie (Fachverband Fahrzeugindustrie). Wir bieten aber auf jeden Fall eine marktkonforme Bezahlung in Abhängigkeit von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung.

Interessiert?
Dann nutzen Sie unser Online-Bewerbungstool um Ihre Bewerbung an AVL zu senden.

Gehalt: 55000 EUR / YEAR
