title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
description:
About the job

The Data Scientist is responsible for leveraging internal and external data by applying data science (data mining, statistics, artificial intelligence) to discover insights, generate predictions and optimize processes.

Your tasks among others will be

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to :
• Designing and developing Advanced Analytics assets by translating business questions and requirements into actionable insights
• Partnering with other Business Functions to align with market state-of-the-art solutions and identify Advanced Analytics opportunities to be embedded the existing processes
• Leverage the Data Lake information and cloud infrastructure as well as the current technology landscape to design the solutions
• Developing data science products ensuring business improvements are impactful and aligned to the company objectives and strategy, including appropriate and structured documentation of the methodology and data used
• Selecting features... builds and optimizing models mainly using Machine Learning and other Advanced Analytics techniques
• Coordinating with the Innovation reference people to run pilot activities (e.g. A / B testing) needed to validate business outcomes
• Presenting results and insights to business and driving the conversation about innovation directions in the Advanced Analytics space

About you

We are looking for a unique and amazing talent, who brings along the following :
• University degree / Education, preferably in in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar
• Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a similar role within an international setting (experience in consulting role is a plus)
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent English proficiency, presentation and communication skills
• R and / or Python, modelling & real time analytics, database languages (e.g., SQL) and Big Data frameworks
• Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform is a plus
• Team orientation, and ability to work and interface effectively with all levels of the organization
• Innovative and creative attitude

What we offer

You can expect a range of benefits, including :
• Swarovski products discounts
• Employee Assistance Program
• Volunteering leave
• Learning and development programs, training and further education offers
• Flexible working time models (flextime, home office, part-time, etc.)
• Travel allowance / public transport ticket / bike leasing
• Company subsidy for lunch in the canteens
• Company pension plan (from the 3rd year of employment)
• Childbirth grant, other personal allowances, if applicable
• Company crèche, summer holiday care for children
• Free sports and health programs
• Voluntary profit-sharing
• Subsidy for private health insurance
• Loyalty benefits such as bonuses, anniversary gifts, etc.
• Rent of company apartments for the employees

Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories.

Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people.

Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group.

A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski’s heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard.

A place where anyone / everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.

We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.

Due to legal reasons, we advise that the collectively agreed base monthly salary for this position is at least € 3.497,87 gross.

Our actual salaries are market competitive and take individual qualifications and experience into consideration

title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
description:
Technologien auf das nächste Level heben. Sich Herausforderungen stellen und an den Innovationen von morgen arbeiten - dafür benötigen wir bei FERCHAU Experten wie Sie: Wir realisieren spannende Projekte für namhafte Anbieter:innen und Entwickler:innen von IT-Lösungen für smarte Integration von IT-Trends und etablierten Lösungen.

Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Das sind Ihre Aufgaben in unserem Team
• Konzipierung und eigenständige Durchführung von IoT-Datenanalysen in einem Scrum-Team für ein internationales Projekt
• Aufbau und Integration eines Frameworks zur Erkennung von Anomalien basierend auf maschinennahen Zeitreihendaten
• Kontinuierliches Modifizieren der errechneten Modelle unter Berücksichtigung von domänenspezifischem Wissen
• Kommunikation und Abstimmung mit internationalen Teams

Das nächste Level beginnt hier
• Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung durch Gleitzeitregelungen und Home Office
• Attraktive Büros und einen Arbeitsplatz mit moderner Hardware
• Bei uns können Sie... Verantwortung übernehmen und sich weiterentwickeln
• Diverse WeiterbildungsangeboteDas bringen Sie mit
• Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung mit Spezialisierung im Bereich Data Science
• Einschlägige Erfahrung in der Datenverarbeitung und -modellierung sowie mit Datenkompressions- und Datenvorverarbeitungstechniken
• Sehr gute Kenntnisse der Programmiersprachen Python
• Erfahrung mit Angular und Typescript wünschenswert
• Verhandlungssicheres Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und SchriftFür diese Position beträgt das Jahresbruttogehalt mindestens EUR 44.800. Wir bieten eine marktkonforme Überzahlung abhängig von Ausbildung, beruflicher Qualifikation und Erfahrung.

Das klingt nach einem "Perfect Fit" für Sie? Dann bewerben Sie sich bei uns - gerne online unter der Kennziffer FE45-85492-LZ bei Frau Iris Bogner. Alles über unseren Bewerbungsprozess erfahren Sie auf unserer Website im Bewerberbereich. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Frau Iris Bogner
Personalreferentin
iris.bogner@ferchau.com
+43 732 210324-17

Das klingt nach einem "Perfect Fit" für Sie? Dann bewerben Sie sich bei uns - gerne online unter der Kennziffer FE45-85492-LZ bei Frau Iris Bogner. Alles über unseren Bewerbungsprozess erfahren Sie auf unserer Website im Bewerberbereich. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!

Frau Iris Bogner
Personalreferentin
iris.bogner@ferchau.com
+43 732 210324-17']}]

title: Data Scientist/Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
IFE is the worldwide leading manufacturer of automatic entrance systems for railway vehicles. Wouldn’t it be great to play an active part in shaping the future of mobility?

We are an innovative company and use data from our door systems on railroad vehicles to predict future failures using Big Data analytics in the cloud. For this purpose, we are looking for someone to join our team for data analysis and development of algorithms for Condition Based Maintenance (CBM).

YOUR TASKS
• ANALYZE... the process and environment data of our train door systems.
• IDENTIFICATION... of anomalies
• DEVELOPMENT... of machine learning models
• DATA ENGINEERING... to further develop our data processing pipeline.
• COLLABORATION...through cross-disciplinary teamwork with development and services
• COMMUNICATION .....and visualization of results
• SHAPING... the mobility of the future

YOUR PROFILE
• Master in Data Science, Industrial IT
• very good knowledge in Python or R
• experience with SPARK... (DATABRICKS, Azure, AWS) an advantage
• experience with version management like Git, Devops
• good technical understanding (electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics, ...) an advantage
• experience in leading interdisciplinary teams
• ability to work independently
• very good knowledge of German and English

WHAT WE OFFER

Continuous innovation pushes the technological progress of our automatic entrance systems, which are geared towards quality, safety and reliability, and distinguishes us as an internationally reliable partner.
We offer you an exciting and varied job in an international environment as well as an attractive set of benefits. These range from flexible working time (up to 50% homeoffice) models through professional and personal development opportunities to sports and health care programmes.

The minimum salary for this position is EUR 3.500,00 gross monthly or more depending on qualifications and experience.

ARE YOU INTERESTED?

Apply now online if you want to advance in a strong team. We look forward to receiving your application

title: Senior Data Scientist: NLP
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Europe

This offer from "Clarity" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 76% flex score.
This position can be based in London or Madrid. Remote options are available as well across the EU.

At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision making within financial markets.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as BlackRock, Deutsche Börse and Softbank who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

What are we looking for?

We like... data scientists that work with data in a scientific way and that share our passion for bringing social impact to the markets and making a difference. At Clarity you will help develop the “gold standard” to quantify social impact that will be used by investors, consumers and governments:
• Use state of the art NLP tools, including the latest large language models, to efficiently extract, classify, and generate sustainability information
• Working side-by-side with a top-talent team from business and academia.

As the ideal candidate for the position:
• >4 years of working experience as a Data Scientist, 2 years experience with NLP
• You excel at problem solving:
• Clarifying the nature of a problem and formulating relevant questions.
• Breaking down a problem into smaller, more manageable parts, creating business value every step of the way.
• Deciding among possible solutions in a critical way.
• Implementing actions and evaluating outcomes in a quantitative way.
• You have strong communication skills. The right candidate can thrive in an environment of asynchronous conversation, since a part of the Clarity team is based outside Europe. We expect you to have strong communication skills and be able to create working relationships with coworkers across various locations.
• You possess and know how to share technical expertise:
• Practitioner of modern NLP tools and techniques for classification, extraction, summarization, regression etc
• Proficiency in standard tools
• Preferred Python and its data science ecosystem (spacy, nltk, Hugging Face, OpenAI, etc).
• SQL and noSQL databases
• and techniques:
• Data processing and cleaning
• Working with limited labeled data and humans in the loop
• Fine tuning and stacking of models
• Regression, classification, clustering and other standard algorithms.
• Bonus points if you have experience in
• Deploying big data technologies like Spark or Dask
• Using pipeline orchestration tools like Airflow
• Work experience in a software company / using software best practices in your day-to-day work
• You have a start-up way of working:
• Self-motivation and drive to succeed.
• Getting-the-job-done mentality.
• Learn by doing, all the time.
• Authorized to work in Europe / UK

Responsibilities of the role include
• You are expected to expand the technical expertise of our current NLP team. You will share that expertise by both providing technical guidance to the team and mentoring junior members.
• Day-to-day, you will have freedom to research, design, validate, and deploy NLP models to improve our current NLP systems.

- WHAT WE OFFER:

People are one of Clarity’s main assets. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values.
• The team comprises professionals from leading consulting and banking firms, MBA graduates from top business schools, entrepreneurs and researchers and PhDs.
• Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum.

We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:
• Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
• Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
• Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
• Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
• Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).

Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups.

Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).

To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.

By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

We care about our employees. We think that every effort has to be rewarded and want them to feel comfortable with us.
• ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.
• Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.
• Amazing office in Madrid: We are located at Paseo de la Castellana 43 28046 Madrid Floors 5th and 6th floors.

We are a US company with a Spanish and London subsidiary. We have offices in NY, London, Abu Dhabi and Madrid, and a remote culture.

Our investors believe in us and share our goals. We are a leading startup thanks to public and private funding.

Clarity has received several awards:
• Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017.
• Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent.
• Top 2 start-ups with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017.
• One of the most innovative Spanish companies by NeoTec.
• One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab

(SENIOR) DATA SCIENTIST - BUYING SERVICES (M/W/D)

20-38,5 h

HOFER, mein Arbeitgeber

HOFER bietet als Österreichs beliebtester Lebensmitteleinzelhändler mit mehr als 530 Filialen all denen das richtige Umfeld, die loslegen möchten und sich selbst viel zutrauen. Deshalb geben wir unseren Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern Raum für Verantwortung, in dem sich jeder einbringen kann. Gegenseitiger Ansporn und Zusammenhalt sind unser Antrieb, so kommen wir gemeinsam immer einen Schritt weiter. Das ist der richtige Weg für uns.

• Erstellen von statistischen Analysemodellen (z.B. Python, R), die nahtlos in analytische Datenprodukte integriert werden

• eigenständiges Erarbeiten von statistischen Tests und analytischen Modellen zur Erfüllung von Businessanforderungen der internen Einkaufsabteilungen
• aktives... Zusammenarb

title: Sr. Solution Engineer (Data Scientist) German speaker (f/m/d)
description:
As Senior Solution Engineer in the Customer Success & Solutions team, you are responsible for leading and delivering intelligent automation solutions to our customers based on our products. This involves diverse tasks from evaluating customer requirements, technical solution consulting, solution design, project planning, data evaluation, solution implementation, solving data science challenges, and customer onboarding.

Aufgaben
• Take responsibility for technical planning and solution design by transforming customer requirements into efficient cognitive automation workflows by leveraging our internal software solutions suite.
• Own the ongoing technical communication across various stages with the customer. Be the trusted go-to technical contact for the customer. Support Pre-Sales and Customer-Success Team with technical know-how.
• Deliver the implementation of cognitive automation solutions to meet customer requirements within the project timeline.
• Navigate enterprise... environments both technically and communication-wise. This means using your knowledge of enterprise environments to help customers in setting up the communication efficiently, communicating requirements and responsibilities clearly, ensuring fast feedback loops, and supporting the setup and use of our on premise-software solutions.
• Transform data from customers into high-quality input for machine learning and data analysis. This involves data gathering from web API's, exploratory data analysis, data cleaning, transforming data, data validation, and optimization of data label quality for the training of high-performance machine learning models.
• Ensure that delivered solutions continue to operate smoothly and provide proactive technical support to customers as needed.
• Establish implementation processes and contribute code that improves the time spent on projects and also ensures the high quality of the solution delivered.
• Extend and enhance the solution engineering toolbox with the latest technologies to optimize the implementation projects' efficiency and results.
• Collaborate and communicate internally with the customer success, machine learning & product engineering team. This includes project reviews, helping to conceptualize new features, ongoing communication of customer needs, and relevant insights learned.

Qualifikation

Fluent in German and English is necessary for this role
• A degree in a quantitative scientific discipline (Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or similar) and/or significant experience working as a Solution Engineer or Solution Architect or Data Scientist/Data Engineer, ideally with corporate customers or in a corporate environment
• Experience with data handling/data wrangling: Exploratory data analysis, data cleaning, data transformations, data visualization, building end-to-end data processing pipelines
• Experience in software development
• Great presentation and communication skills
• Scientific thinking: Ability to break down a concept into its causal parts, reasoning from first principles
• Demonstrated proficiency in Python or similar high-level programming languages
• Highly motivated to deliver exceptional outcomes for our customers
• Reliable in delivering on deadlines in challenging and new projects
• Experience with enterprise on-premise software environments is an advantageFluent in German and English is necessary for this role

Our stack
• OS: Linux
• Languages: python, bash
• Libs: numpy, scikit-learn, matplotlib, apache-airflow, jupyter, AutoNLU (in-house)
• Tools: git, docker, apache-airflow, Power-BI, TableauAPI: studio-api (in-house)

Benefits
• We are a startup. That means you can still shape team, products and processes and have an impact from day one
• Connect with highly motivated, committed colleagues that together shape the future of cognitive automations with focus on Natural Language Processing
• Contribute to building world-class products with a real impact for users, customers and in the industry
• Enjoy a trust-based, open-minded working environment with flat hierarchies
• We work agile and iteratively deliver towards our milestones and goals. We do code reviews and pair programming
• We work closely together in the whole team, we help each other out, we share knowledge, we take responsibility, we give and take feedback, we spar, we communicate
• Work in a spacious office in the heart of the Alps with the option to work remote
• Receive a competitive compensation package

DeepOpinion is a well-financed and rapidly growing SaaS technology startup located in Innsbruck and Munich. DeepOpinion is surfing the next wave of automation solutions that will enable companies to automate repetitive cognitive processes using AI/machine learning. Our mission is to free people from repetitive cognitive tasks so that their work is meaningful again, ultimately shaping the future of work

title: Data Scientist (w/m/d)
description:
High Tech | High Speed | High Quality

Pankl Racing Systems ist auf die Entwicklung und Produktion von Motor- und Antriebssystemen für den Rennsport, für High Performance Fahrzeuge und die Luftfahrtindustrie spezialisiert. Pankl punktet in diesen Nischenmärkten mit Leichtbaukomponenten aus hochwertigen, innovativen Werkstoffen, die für extreme mechanische Belastungen ausgelegt sind. Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams wird aktuell folgende Stelle ausgeschrieben:
Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Ihr Verantwortungsbereich
• Aufbereitung, Analyse, Organisation und Modellierung von Daten
• Empfehlungen und Mithilfe bei der Datenerfassung und Organisation der Speicherung
• Entwicklung, Implementierung & Wartung KI basierender Systeme
• Identifikation von Potentialen und Use Cases für die Anwendung von KI
• Zusammenarbeit mit den jeweiligen Fachbereichen im Entwicklungsprozess
• Erstellung, Präsentation und Kommunikation von Erkenntnissen und Ergebnissen
Ihr Profil
• FH oder TU für Data Science... Informatik, Mathematik/Statistik oder vergleichbares
• Fundierte Kenntnisse in Statistik, Mathematik und KI-Methoden
• Kompetenz im Bereich des Data Engineerings und Data Warehousing
• Erfahrung im Umgang mit unstrukturierten Daten (Bilder, Videos, Text)
• Programmiererfahrung: Python, R, KNIME, SQL o.ä.
• Erfahrung im Einsatz von Deep Learning Tools wie z.B. TensorFlow, o.ä.
• Berufserfahrung im Industrieumfeld von Vorteil
• Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
• Pflichtbewusste, gewissenhafte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise
• Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie soziale Kompetenz
• Flexibilität
• Sicheres und selbstbewusstes Auftreten
Unser Angebot

Wir bieten ein modernes und dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld sowie eine einzigartige Unternehmensstruktur, geprägt von Kollegialität und Teamspirit. Im Pankl Team erwarten Sie interessante, abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeiten. Für diese Position gilt ein Mindestgrundgehalt von € 50.000,-- brutto pro Jahr (+ eventuelle Zulagen, Prämien etc.) . Wir bieten jedoch eine marktkonforme Bezahlung in Abhängigkeit Ihrer Qualifikation und Vorerfahrung.
• Leistungsgerechte Bezahlung
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten
• Vielfältige Karrieremöglichkeiten
• Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung
• Betriebskantine mit täglich frisch zubereiteten Gerichten
• Mitarbeiterevents
• Gesundheit
• Zahlreiche Mitarbeitervergünstigungen

• Empfehlungen und Mithilfe bei der Datenerfassung und Organisation der Speicherung
• Entwicklung, Implementierung & Wartung KI basierender Systeme
• Identifikation von Potentialen und Use Cases für die Anwendung von KI
• Zusammenarbeit mit den jeweiligen Fachbereichen im Entwicklungsprozess
• Erstellung, Präsentation und Kommunikation von Erkenntnissen und Ergebnissen
Ihr Profil
• FH oder TU für Data Science... Informatik, Mathematik/Statistik oder vergleichbares
• Fundierte Kenntnisse in Statistik, Mathematik und KI-Methoden
• Kompetenz im Bereich des Data Engineerings und Data Warehousing
• Erfahrung im Umgang mit unstrukturierten Daten (Bilder, Videos, Text)
• Programmiererfahrung: Python, R, KNIME, SQL o.ä.
• Erfahrung im Einsatz von Deep Learning Tools wie z.B. TensorFlow, o.ä.
• Berufserfahrung im Industrieumfeld von Vorteil
• Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
• Pflichtbewusste, gewissenhafte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise
• Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie soziale Kompetenz
• Flexibilität
• Sicheres und selbstbewusstes Auftreten
Unser Angebot

Wir bieten ein modernes und dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld sowie eine einzigartige Unternehmensstruktur, geprägt von Kollegialität und Teamspirit. Im Pankl Team erwarten Sie interessante, abwechslungsreiche und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeiten. Für diese Position gilt ein Mindestgrundgehalt von € 50.000,-- brutto pro Jahr (+ eventuelle Zulagen, Prämien etc.) . Wir bieten jedoch eine marktkonforme Bezahlung in Abhängigkeit Ihrer Qualifikation und Vorerfahrung.
• Leistungsgerechte Bezahlung
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten
• Vielfältige Karrieremöglichkeiten
• Fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklung
• Betriebskantine mit täglich frisch zubereiteten Gerichten
• Mitarbeiterevents
• Gesundheit
• Zahlreiche Mitarbeitervergünstigungen']}]

title: Data Science/NLP/Data Analyst Virtual Internship
description:
Data Science/NLP/Data Analyst Virtual Internship ( 30 Oct-Jan 2023)

Virtual Internship Details
• This is a 13 weeks program and can be extended for university students.
• There is no stipend as we will not be utilizing the work of intern and there is no time constraint from our side (No minimum logging hours, you are allowed to work on assigned task as per your availability)
• There is no contract and you can quit or ask for extension if you have any emergency.
• Virtual internship will provide you same environment as you will get in the industry.
• Mentorship option will be available to students even after the completion of the program.
• Everything will be done virtually and task/project and other deliverables will be assigned through dashboard.
• You will get both individual as well as group assignments during this internship.
• There is a registration fee for add-on services (eg: Mentorship, webinar, Resume and Job Preparation ) which is one time fee and there is no fee after... this.
• This registration fee will be used for admin, mentorship, webinar and program management.
• Data Glacier will not utilize the work of interns and intern will have full right to use and brand the data product/code developed during this internship
• This is intern driven program.
• This is not a course.
• Data Glacier will provide the Internship completion certificate after successful completion of the program.
• Data Glacier will educate intern on relevant topics of this internship through webinars (given by industry experts)
• Intern will get opportunity to understand end to end lifecycle of Data and Analytics (including data engineering).

Please choose virtual internship specialization
• Data Science
• NLP
• Data Analyst

Selection Process

https://www.dataglacier.org/virtual-internship

title: HQ - Data Science Manager (EMEA Remote)
description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Europe, Africa

This offer from "Jobandtalent" has been enriched by Jobgether and got a 82.5% flex score.
Join us to work on the future of work: your next adventure awaits!

As the Data Science Manager, you will be responsible for leading a cross-functional team of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. You will oversee multiple projects focused on optimization, Machine Learning, and Generative AI, and manage a group of 8-10 people.

Responsabilities
• The Data Team builds and manages the services that run our AI models and our data storage. We work in partnership with different Product teams, usually by providing API with solutions that can improve the quality and efficiency of the product. A few examples of projects are:
• Work on the Worker Quality Score model of our users and clients, using the various different types of data sources we have to be a fair model that can estimate the performance and the engagement of the... users with that specific client environment.
• Work on the Candidate Quality prediction, forecasting what kind of performance these new candidates (people that never worked with us) will have for a specific job position.
• Work on the Matching Algorithm, improving the ranking model that combines multiple algorithms to match the best workers and candidates to a given job position, and the invitation logic that is deciding how many workers we should invite in a given period of time.
• Work on the ML Lifecycle (collaborative exploration, continuous model training, deployment, model serving, features store, monitoring, etc.)
• .Work on generative AI models that can automate different tasks from the clients' vacancy requests creation to the workers’ customer support use cases.

Requirements
• Technical degree in Engineering or a Quantitative field, a Ph.D. is a plus.
• Preferred a mix of experience in both startup and big enterprise environments
• Proven ability to supervise multiple projects, ensuring they are working toward clear and measurable objectives.
• Lead and mentor a team of Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers, providing guidance and support throughout the project lifecycle.
• Collaborate with stakeholders (Product and Data Product Managers) to understand business requirements and translate them into data science solutions.
• Good programming skills with Python and SQL, being hands-on in advanced Data Analysis.
• Obsess with the development of best practices, standards, and guidelines for data science methodologies and workflows (PR/code review, documentation, monitoring, data quality observability, etc.).
• Experience Apache Airflow and Spark
• A plus – experience with ML libraries such as XGBoost, TensorFlow, Or-Tools.
• Fluent in English is a must, able to communicate effectively with different levels of management, as well as the business and technical communities.
• Willingness to be on-call if needed (the on-call weeks are paid on top of the salary).

About us

We are Jobandtalent, a world-leading platform for essential workers, matching great people with great companies directly through our app. Founded in Spain in 2009, we’re reshaping temporary work by tearing down the barriers to job searching and hiring, and harnessing the power of technology and data. We connect workers with back-to-back job opportunities through our platform, providing them with the stability and perks of full-time employment and helping them to feel valued, respected and integral in their roles. Having put simplicity and fairness at the core of the business model, we placed more than 340,000 workers in over 2,500 companies across a variety of industries including logistics and retail last year.

Headquartered in sunny Madrid, but home to the world, we are a remote-first company operating in 11 countries across Europe, the U.S. and Latin America. While we’re distributed globally, we’re united in our mission: to empower the people that make our world go round. We need a passionate team to revolutionize the employment market with us.

What we offer:

Be challenged: Make an impact through extreme ownership and develop your career while working alongside an international, diverse and multidisciplinary team. We’re driven by our mission to empower the people that make our world go round and you can play an integral role in this transformation.

Be rewarded: With financial recognition ingrained into our company philosophy, we offer our employees competitive salaries and benefits. Our Talent Acquisition team is happy to elaborate on the specific benefits for your region.

Be supported: We believe there’s no better way to grow than by doing, and at Jobandtalent you’ll have the chance to grow with us at rocket speed. As a remote-first company, we’ll support you in working from wherever you thrive.

At Jobandtalent we value diversity and strive to be an equitable and inclusive employer. We welcome people from all backgrounds and look forward to your application

title: Data Scientist f/m/d
description:
Data Scientist f/m/d

Data scientists develop and execute software algorithms to extract information from structured and unstructured data in cooperation with domain experts of the according technical field. The ideal candidates must have a strong experience using a variety of data analytics methods and tools, developing and implementing models and algorithms. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidates will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities using data and knowledge from the automotive domain to drive business solutions
• Design and implement metrics, applications and tools that will enable engineers to derive better conclusions (ad-hoc... and automated analysis cases)
• Apply statistical modeling, learning and machine learning techniques to optimize processes and support engineering decisions
• Design graphical representations and visuals that engineers can easily interpret and understand
• Support the scale out of design algorithms via implementation in larger software frameworks
• Keep up to date on relevant technologies and frameworks, identify trends and propose new methods that the team could benefit from
• Ability and interest to extend knowledge beyond own field of expertise (e.g. powertrain, e-drive, battery, electronics, etc.)
• Active support and engagement for pre-sales and sales activities (RFQ, RFP handling)

YOUR PROFILE:
• University degree education (MSc, MEng or PhD) in Mathematics/Statistics, Informatics/Telematics or Computer Science
• Proven experience in applying data science methods in industrial use cases
• Strong proficiency in Python (optional: R, Scala, Julia or comparable) and experience in scalable processing environments like Spark or Dask preferable
• Strong soft skills in leadership, communication and facilitation in the teams and working with many different stakeholders with conflicting requirements and needs
• Strong problem-solving skills to help refining unclear problem statements and figure out how to solve them with the available data
• Experience building machine learning models in a professional environment
• Highly developed quality awareness with strong attention to details, ability to work in team, organizational skills
• Willingness to travel in the context of project execution
• German skills preferred, fluent in English

WE OFFER:
• Homeoffice
• Flexitime Regulation
• Canteen
• Award-winning Training Programs
• Health Management
• Parental Leave Management (Maternity/Paternity Protection & Educational Leave)

Annual Remuneration: Due to the Austrian Equal Treatment Act we are obligated to state the annual gross remuneration (full-time) for this position as a basis for negotiation: €55.000,00. The Employee will be classified according to the Collective Agreement for Employees of Industry (Collective Bargaining Agreement of the Automotive Industry). We will, in any case, offer market-conforming payment taking qualifications and professional experience into account.

Interested?
If so, please use our online application tool to send your application to AVL!

About AVL

AVL is one of the world’s leading mobility technology companies for development, simulation and testing in the automotive industry, and beyond. We provide concepts, solutions and methodologies in fields like vehicle development and integration, e-mobility, automated and connected mobility (ADAS/AD), and software for a greener, safer, better world of mobility.

Find out more: www.avl.com

You are interested in a job at AVL but you are not sure how to apply or want to know what happens after you send your application?

Check out our step-by-step guide

AVL is not just about cars. It's about changing the future. Together.

Location: Graz, AT

Company: AVL List GmbH

Job Function: IT & Software

Contract Type: Permanent

Posting Date: Jul 10, 2023

Job ID: 35778

About AVL

AVL is one of the world’s leading mobility technology companies for development, simulation and testing in the automotive industry, and beyond. We provide concepts, solutions and methodologies in fields like vehicle development and integration, e-mobility, automated and connected mobility (ADAS/AD), and software for a greener, safer, better world of mobility.

Find out more: www.avl.com

Job Segment: Pre-Sales, Computer Science, RFP, Informatics, Sales, Technology, Automotive

title: Data Scientist (m/f/x)
description: Company DescriptionDynatrace exists to make software work perfectly. Our platform combines broad and deep observability and continuous runtime application security with advanced AIOps to provide answers and intelligent automation from data. This enables innovators to modernize and automate cloud operations, deliver software faster and more securely, and ensure flawless digital experiences. That is why the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace® to accelerate digital transformation.Job DescriptionExcited about huge performance and monitoring data sets? Passionate about bringing machine learning models to life? Eager to join a global leader that enables digital transformation? Your role in the team: Design use cases for taking advantage of our huge performance and monitoring data sets Develop and release new Machine Learning models for different use cases (e.g., prediction, classification, clustering) Ensure quality of Machine Learning models (monitor, analyze, improve) Cooperate... with Development and Product Management to integrate Machine Learning models into our product QualificationsYour profile:More than 3 years of experience in software development in a high-level language (e.g., Java, C++ or Python) More than 3 years of experience in working with databases (SQL, dbt is beneficial) Experience in building machine learning models (e.g., support vector machines, random forest, neural networks) Hands-on team player and proactive (wo)man of action. Additional InformationWhat's in it for you?  A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.   Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.   Working models that offer you the flexibility you need (hybrid ones combining home and in-office work).   A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.    An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.   A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.    A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all. A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.  A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side. If you need to relocate for a position you are applying for, we offer you a relocation allowance and support with your visa, work permit, accommodation, language courses, as well as a dedicated buddy program.Attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.   Please apply with your resume in English. If you have examples of your writing, it would be beneficial to share them with us.  Compensation and rewardsWe offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 45,500 gross per year based on full-time employment (38.5 h/week). We offer a higher salary in line with qualification and experience

title: (Junior) Data Scientist
description:
You want to be part of a digital spin-off within Red Bull working on a novel data analytics product? TV Insight, located in Elsbethen (Austria) works on revolutionizing the TV measurement and advertisement industry.

As a data scientist, you’ll be creating and improving the analytical foundation of our new product that is able to handle multiple millions of classification tasks every second. In a team of data scientists, you will define the success of a state-of-the-art analytics product collaborating with data engineers, analysts, and business stakeholders.

Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:
• 1-2 years’ experience in quantitative analytics and/or statistics (e.g., from part-time jobs or internships)
• Advanced experience in application of statistical modelling (e.g., R, or Python with willingness to learn other)
• Experience with data base languages (e.g., SQL)
• Experience with statistical techniques, including regression, classification, and... testing
• Ability to translate your findings into clear and concise visualizations (e.g., ggplot, R Shiny, or Data Studio)
• Ability to give understandable presentations on complex topics
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Master’s degree or PhD in highly quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, etc.
• Strong English skills, German beneficial
• Travel 10%
• Permanent

title: ▷ (26.07.2023) Data Scientist
description:
Programmiersprachen, Data Science, Datenanalyse, Datenanalytik, Python

Hannover Re - 3,500 employees at 170 locations worldwide. Our strength? Connecting Power: We rely on each other. As a reinsurer, we protect our clients in the event of a loss. This requires tailor-made, innovative solutions. Solutions that were right yesterday may be outdated tomorrow. We challenge ourselves and continuously optimize our services, consulting and products. All this makes us one of the leading and most profitable reinsurance groups in the world and a reliable employer.

Join our department Latin America, Iberian Peninsula at our Hannover location on a full-time, permanent basis as soon as possible as

Data Scientist:in with underwriting skills for the Latin American market.

Your tasks

Join our team and create computational tools to automate underwriting processes, thus increasing efficiency in this area.

- Design computational tools to achieve results using mathematical models applied to data... sets.
- Interpretation of data, analysis of results using statistical techniques.
- Data analysis with a focus on reinsurance results
- Analysis of reinsurance requests from our clients including risk assessment.
- Preparation and execution of quotations and underwriting decisions
- Maintaining, developing and building sustainable customer relationships.

Your profile

- Master's degree in data analytics or economics with a quantitative focus or (business) mathematics.
- Knowledge of a higher level programming language, e.g. R or Python
- Ideally, experience in the insurance sector, e.g., in the support of corporate clients or in actuarial services
- Reference to Latin America
- Spanish or Portuguese at native level (C2), English at business fluent level (at least C1).
- Willingness to travel worldwide, circa two to three times a year.

Personally, you convince with your strong analytical thinking skills and your solution-oriented approach. If you also bring a team-oriented work style and have a high motivation and strong communication skills, you are exactly right with us!

Our offer

Atmosphere: With us, you will encounter an international working environment with short decision-making paths, an open feedback culture and a togetherness that is characterized by appreciation and helpfulness.
Performance: A structured induction, flexible working hours, benefits above the standard pay scale as well as contemporary offers for personal development, health management and work-life balance are just some of our benefits.
Perspective: You bring your technical and methodological expertise with you and we offer you new impulses and the opportunity to further develop your potential. Room for innovative ideas and their implementation included!

If you too would like to work differently with certainty, apply simply and securely via our application portal, quoting the reference number 1161.

You can find out more about our working environment, your entry options and development opportunities at www.hannover-rueck.de/karriere.

hannover-rueck.jobs

title: Data Scientist Supply Chain Management (m/w/d)
description:
Aufgaben, die mich erwarten
• aktives Mitwirken bei der Entwicklung und Optimierung unserer Warenbedarfsplanung
• Unterstützen bei quantitativen und qualitativen Analysen unserer Produkte und Warengruppen
• Ermitteln, Validieren und Optimieren von Prognoseparametern unter Berücksichtigung der Bedarfseinflussfaktoren
• selbstständiges Ausarbeiten und Simulieren von Szenarien zur Optimierung unserer Beschaffungsstrategie
• enges Zusammenarbeiten und kontinuierliches Abstimmen von Ergebnissen mit internen Abteilungen

Qualifikationen, die ich mitbringe
• laufendes oder abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt Mathematik, Statistik, Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder Supply Chain Management
• Berufserfahrung im Umgang mit Datenverarbeitung
• fundierte Kenntnisse in Excel, Erfahrungen mit SAP, RStudio/Matlab sowie Programmierkenntnisse von Vorteil
• gute Englischkenntnisse
• ausgeprägtes Interesse für Datenanalyse
• Bereitschaft sich in neue Bereiche einzuarbeiten und innovative... Lösungen zu entwickeln
• analytische, selbstständige und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise

Angebote, die mich überzeugen
• vielseitiges Tätigkeitsfeld
• umfangreiche Einarbeitung
• top ausgestatteter ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz in einem modernen Bürogebäude
• Möglichkeit im Home-Office zu arbeiten (bis zu 50 %)
• zahlreiche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zur Unterstützung der persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklung
• kostenlose Verpflegung in Form von täglich frischem Obst und Gemüse, Kaffee sowie Tee
• Möglichkeit eines mehrmonatigen Sabbaticals
• sicherer und verlässlicher Arbeitgeber

Entgelt

attraktives Brutto-Monatseinstiegsgehalt ab € 3.481,- für 38,5 Stunden/Woche, abhängig von Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung bis € 3.910,- in der Endstufe

Arbeitsort

​4642 Sattledt, Hofer Straße 1​

Arbeitsbeginn

​ab sofort​

Online bewerben

Jetzt online bewerben und Lebenslauf inklusive Foto sowie sämtliche relevante Zeugnisse beifügen

title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
ABOUT BIKE CITIZENS

We’re a team of 30+ located in Graz and Berlin. Bike Citizens started out by creating the world’sfirst navigation app that focuses on urban cycling. Together with our partner cities and municipalities we’re building the digital home for the urban cyclist – motivating and empowering more and more people to use the bicycle for their daily journeys

AT THIS JOB YOU WILL

– Processing, evaluation and visualization of aggregated sensor data on bicycle traffic

– Processing, evaluation and visualization of usage and traffic planning data on the topic of bicycle traffic

– (Further) development of bicycle sensor technology

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

– Relevant (completed) studies (e.g.: computer science, physics, electrical engineering, mathematics)

– Knowledge in the field of data analysis and visualization

– Experience with processing of electronic hardware sensor data (radar, ultrasound, motion sensors) especially using machine learning techniques

– Knowledge of the... Python programming language and the corresponding libraries (NumPy, Tensorflow, etc.)

– Experience with GIS data processing is an advantage

WE OFER YOU

– Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home

– 4-day work week – the weekend starts on Thursday evening!

– Working in a young, dynamic and professional team

– Breakfast on Monday with the team for a great start in the week and cooking sessions at lunchtime

– Company and team building events (Company Fitness, Pub Quiz, excursions, etc…)

– Our office is located in the center of Graz with the possibility for great after-work activities

If that sounds like you – we’re dead keen to get to know you!

Salary: The minimum salary is €3.000,- gross/month for a 36h base.

Your actual salary will depend on your experience, skills, contribution to Bike Citizens and is to be negotiated.

Let’s talk: job@bikecitizens.net

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Deine Rolle im Team
• **Develop** and improve the **core data engine** of the company that focuses on matching customers with retail partners to optimize their household expenses
• **Lead the technical team within a high-profile technology grant** and ensure that results are delivered in a timely and high-quality manner
• **Collaborate** with development teams **to design and build the date pipelines** to provide recommendations to users via the app and measure outcomes to further improve the data engine
• Work with company founders to further develop the companies'**business intelligence setup** and **reporting structures** to support data-driven decision-making
Technologien und Skills
• Python
• scikit-learn
• FastAPI
• Flask
• Core Data
• SQL
• Pandas
Unsere Erwartungen an dich:
Qualifikationen
• You are working in a**self-directed** way and enjoy following through new developments from concept stage all the way to implementation.
• You are proficient in working at... the**intersection of science and business** where you thrive at implementing **innovative new solutions** that create **real business impact** .
• You are a**team player** and like to work in a highly collaborative environment.
• You speak**English fluently (minimum B2)** and are capable of communicating complex technical concepts in the language - German language skills are a plus.
• You have extensive knowledge of**Python** and the relevant packages (e.g. Scikit-learn, Pandas, Flask/FastAPI) as well as **SQL** .
• You are not just able to**create machine learning models** but are also able to **create and deploy the relevant pipelines** to get your model out to customers
Erfahrung
• You are experienced in**applying statistical and quantitative models** to real world problems and are able to extract the key information and present it for business use.
Ausbildung
• Completed Bachelor, Master or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field, alternatively 3-5 years of work experience in real-life data science applications
Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten
• Gute Anbindung

title: Data Scientist Machine Learning Developer
description:
Deine Rolle im Team
• Selbstständige Entwicklung von Lösungen im Bereich Bildverarbeitung für Qualitätssicherungsanwendungen
• Automatisierungsaufgaben auf Basis Robot Operating System
• Data-Mining in Datensätzen der Betriebsdatenerfassung
• Informationstransfer/Koordination mit internen Schnittstellen
• Umsetzung von internen AI-Projekten
• Um das Beste zu erreichen, wirst du bewährtes vergessen müssen.
• Du wirst leidenschaftlich und ehrgeizig das Neue suchen.
• Zu deinen Freunden wirst du mit Stolz sagen: "Ich habe einen klassen Job bei Ginzinger electronic systems".
Technologien und Skills
• TensorFlow
• Python
• Robot Operating System
• Swift
• Kaggle
Unsere Erwartungen an dich:
Qualifikationen
• Kenntnis von GPU, Cloud und Embedded Systems
• Kaggle Referenz vorteilhaft
• Interesse an langfristigem Kompetenzaufbau in AI und Robotik
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Erfahrung
• Erfahrung mit ANN-ML-Anwendungen wie CV
• Erfahrung mit TensorFlow oder einem anderen... Mainstream-Framework
• Erfahrung mit Python oder Swift
• Erfahrung mit SW-Projekt-/Qualitätsmanagement
Ausbildung
• Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung (TU/FH/HTL) und mind. 3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten
• Team Events

title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
description:
At Swarovski, where innovation meets inspiration, our people desire to explore, experience and create. As a Data Scientist (f/m/d) you will get a chance to work in a rewarding role within a diverse team that is pushing boundaries. Be part of a truly iconic global brand, learn and grow with us. We’re bold and inventive, revealing astonishing things like no one else can. A world of wonder awaits you.

About the job

The Data Scientist is responsible for leveraging internal and external data by applying data science (data mining, statistics, artificial intelligence) to discover insights, generate predictions and optimize processes. Your tasks among others will be

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Designing and developing Advanced Analytics assets by translating business questions and requirements into actionable insights
• Partnering with other Business Functions to align with market state-of-the-art solutions and identify Advanced Analytics opportunities to be... embedded the existing processes
• Leverage the Data Lake information and cloud infrastructure as well as the current technology landscape to design the solutions
• Developing data science products ensuring business improvements are impactful and aligned to the company objectives and strategy, including appropriate and structured documentation of the methodology and data used
• Selecting features, builds and optimizing models mainly using Machine Learning and other Advanced Analytics techniques
• Coordinating with the Innovation reference people to run pilot activities (e.g. A/B testing) needed to validate business outcomes
• Presenting results and insights to business and driving the conversation about innovation directions in the Advanced Analytics space

About you

We are looking for a unique and amazing talent, who brings along the following:
• University degree/ Education, preferably in in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar
• Minimum 5 years of professional experience in a similar role within an international setting (experience in consulting role is a plus)
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent English proficiency, presentation and communication skills
• R and/or Python, modelling & real time analytics, database languages (e.g., SQL) and Big Data frameworks
• Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform is a plus
• Team orientation, and ability to work and interface effectively with all levels of the organization
• Innovative and creative attitude

What we offer

You can expect a range of benefits, including:
• Swarovski products discounts
• Employee Assistance Program
• Volunteering leave
• Learning and development programs, training and further education offers
• Flexible working time models (flextime, home office, part-time, etc.)
• Travel allowance/public transport ticket/bike leasing
• Company subsidy for lunch in the canteens
• Company pension plan (from the 3rd year of employment)
• Childbirth grant, other personal allowances, if applicable
• Company crèche, summer holiday care for children
• Free sports and health programs
• Voluntary profit-sharing
• Subsidy for private health insurance
• Loyalty benefits such as bonuses, anniversary gifts, etc.
• Rent of company apartments for the employees

Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories. Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people. Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski’s heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard. A place where anyone/everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.

Due to legal reasons, we advise that the collectively agreed base monthly salary for this position is at least € 3.497,87 gross. Our actual salaries are market competitive and take individual qualifications and experience into consideration

title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
description:
Data Scientist (f/m/d)

zh-technologies is a successful company working in the field of industrial electrical engineering and automation for well-known major customers. At zh-technologies, the focus is on the employee! We attach great importance to everyone being able to contribute and develop according to their strengths. It is very important to us to treat each other with respect, and this is how we manage to realise extraordinary solutions for our customers together. As we are constantly growing, we are looking for you to join our great team!

Tasks:
• Analysis of extensive data sets and their processing for visualisations
• Preparation of statistical analyses
• Creation of dashboards and reports for data visualisation
• Independent developments and implementations

Qualification:
• You have a keen interest in data science topics (machine learning, AI, big data)
• Several years of experience in software development and with database systems
• You are very well versed in ETL... processes and SQL
• Experience with Big Data infrastructures and analysis tools is an advantage
• You have a good command of German and/or English and the ability to communicate technical topics in an understandable way to a non-technical audienceYou are a team player, like to find solutions
• You want to grow, are inquisitive and enjoy your work
• Education in the field of statistics, mathematics, or business informatics (HTL/HAK, FH, university) is also an advantage

Benefits:
• Individual flexible working hours
• Work in a home office possible
• Extensive training and further education opportunities
• Mentoring programme
• Fitness room, balanka, darts, billiards, massage
• Organised lunch
• Parking spaces including e-charging stations
• Free drinks, coffee, teas, fruit etc.
• Exciting and innovative projects for well-known international clients
• Interesting job as a permanent position with fair and performance-related remuneration as well as multi-layered development opportunities in a dynamic, nationally and internationally active company
• Exciting environment in the field of automation technology with resulting changing tasks and opportunities for advancement
• Sponsored company events
• We offer a gross annual salary of at least € 48,000.00 with the possibility of overpayment, depending on your education, qualifications and experience.

The position is based in our new site in Griffen, Austria, in the region of Carinthia. Carinthia is located in the Eastern Alps and is known for its mountains and lakes. Both Italy and Slovenia can be reached within a short car drive. The Austrian social and health care system is among the best in the world, and numerous international studies have distinguished Austria for decades as a particularly safe and prosperous country with a high quality of life for you and your entire family.

Carinthia at the heart of Europe

Contact:

Mrs. Nicole Brumnik

nicole.brumnik@zh-tech.at

title: Data Scientist Engineer (f/m/x)
description:
Innovative, fast and always on the cutting edge.

1000 employees work at 14 sites throughout Europe

Russmedia is the most progressive media company in Europe.

That’s why we provide a modern, state-of-the-art atmosphere to work in;

every employee is encouraged to adopt an entrepreneurial mindset and take responsibility for business outcomes.

A high level of commitment to achieving goals is a central aspect of the daily work at Russmedia.

We are looking for a Data Scientist Engineer (f/m) to join our team and to help taking our business to the next level!

Job Description

These are your responsibilities
• Build ETL pipelines in Python to extract data from various data sources including external APIs, parse, clean, and load into optimized database tables
• Design high-performance database schemas and optimize SQL queries
• Investigate data problems and identify patterns
• Draw inferences and conclusions, communicate results through reports, charts, or tables
• Work closely with... business stakeholders for reporting, data analysis, and ad-hoc data investigations Qualifications

Qualifications

This is you
• You have 2+ years relevant experience in Data Engineering
• You are a pro in Python programming
• You are an expert in SQL and database design and bring a good knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and statistics
• You feel comfortable with the AWS ecosystem (S3, Redshift, EC2)
• You have experience with Google Analytics, Google Big Query, Google Tag Managerbuilding ETL pipelines, Unix shell scripting (the workflow management tool Airflow is plus)
• You have an analytical mind and bake your decisions with data
• You are involved in the whole process of ML model development. This includes everything from root cause analysis, data-mining and feature engineering to training, validating and implementing machine learning models, computing performance statistics and conducting A/B-tests.
• You are fluent in English (both spoken and written) and a strong communicator Additional information

title: Renewal Desk Data Analyst
description: Company DescriptionDynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With automatic and intelligent observability at scale, our all-in-one platform delivers precise answers about the performance and security of applications, the underlying infrastructure, and the experience of all users to enable organizations to innovate faster, collaborate more efficiently, and deliver more value with dramatically less effort. That’s why many of the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace®️ to modernize and automate cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivalled digital experiences.Job DescriptionA Renewal Desk Data Analyst works with Sales Operations, Deal Desk, Renewal Specialists, Order Management, and Account Executives by retrieving, organizing, and analyzing renewal data then crafting into reality a system derived proposal with the details requested. This is accomplished by working in our Saleforce.com... environment and Excel tools. Analyze and review renewal opportunities and account history, gather product details, quantity, purchase price, contract renewal price, partner details/calculations, and contract document reviewWork in a team environment to ensure the completion of assigned task(s) within specified deadlines for an assigned region and in support of a specified Geography(s)Test enhancements to salesforce system in conjunction with Business SystemsOrganize meetings with internal resources to discuss findingsPerform additional duties as requiredQualificationsQualifications:Proven ability to assess, manage and operate effectively given multiple priorities in a mission-critical environment.Self-starter, highly motivated, and committed to getting resultsExcellent mathematical skills with emphasis in accounting or financial mathStrong organizational skills, including detailed record-keeping, excellent and independent follow-through, and a high degree of accuracyExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProven track record of flexibility in a team settingWord processing, advanced Excel and PowerPoint experience in Microsoft OfficeAbility to think outside the box and produce creative solutions if needed, leveraging first principalsAbility to understand and breakdown given answers to produce correct results and expand your problem-solving capabilitiesQuick learner of new concepts and ability to effectively learn new software as neededDesired Skills/Competencies:Knowledge of Dynatrace software productsKnowledge of licensing and product pricingKnowledge of Salesforce.comAdvanced Excel SkillsCollege education – With an emphasis on mathematics (Math, Economics, Accounting, etc)Additional Information***This is a Hybrid role with a split of 2 days in office and 3 days remote

title: Data Scientist Machine Learning Developer
description:
Deine Rolle im Team
• Selbstständige Entwicklung von Lösungen im Bereich Bildverarbeitung für Qualitätssicherungsanwendungen
• Automatisierungsaufgaben auf Basis Robot Operating System
• Data-Mining in Datensätzen der Betriebsdatenerfassung
• Informationstransfer/Koordination mit internen Schnittstellen
• Umsetzung von internen AI-Projekten
• Um das Beste zu erreichen, wirst du bewährtes vergessen müssen.
• Du wirst leidenschaftlich und ehrgeizig das Neue suchen.
• Zu deinen Freunden wirst du mit Stolz sagen: "Ich habe einen klassen Job bei Ginzinger electronic systems".
Technologien und Skills
• TensorFlow
• Python
• Robot Operating System
• Swift
• Kaggle
Unsere Erwartungen an dich:
Qualifikationen
• Kenntnis von GPU, Cloud und Embedded Systems
• Kaggle Referenz vorteilhaft
• Interesse an langfristigem Kompetenzaufbau in AI und Robotik
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Erfahrung
• Erfahrung mit ANN-ML-Anwendungen wie CV
• Erfahrung mit TensorFlow oder einem anderen... Mainstream-Framework
• Erfahrung mit Python oder Swift
• Erfahrung mit SW-Projekt-/Qualitätsmanagement
Ausbildung
• Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung (TU/FH/HTL) und mind. 3 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung
Benefits
• Flexible Arbeitszeiten
• Team Events

description:
The Software Competence Center Hagenberg (SCCH) is an internationally active research company in the field of data science, software science and artificial intelligence. To strengthen our team, we are looking for a dedicated Researcher and Senior Data Scientist with a strong (scientific) background in Computer Vision and Deep Learning.
Your tasks
• Conduct research, develop prototypes and advance methods in the field of Computer Vision
• Foster research topics while working on interesting and diverse research- and industry-related projects
• Be an interactive member of a strong Computer Vision Team, guiding other researchers, interns/students Support proposal writing and project management
• Collaborate with (inter-)national scientific partners
• Publish and present research results at international meetings and scientific conferences
You are
• An excellent communicator
• Great at teamwork as well as with as independent working style
• Well educated with a degree (Master/PhD) in the... field of Data Science, Computer Science or a related field
• Experienced with a strong background in Computer Vision
• Strongly interested in one or several of the following topics (optional):
Deep Learning, Transfer Learning, Anomaly Detection, 3D data analysis, synthetic image generation, multi-modal architectures
• Equipped with a solid scientific record (publications, granted research projects …);
• Experienced in scientific supervision (is a plus)
• Good at programming, especially Python; experienced with Pytorch, Docker and Kubernetes (is a plus)
• Excellent in English; proficiency in German is a plus but not required
We offer
• A creative working environment, varying tasks and development opportunities in science as well as business
• Research in an international team collaborating with top institutes in an international setting, working with state-of-the-art methods and technologies
• Cooperation with leading companies from business and industry
• Family-friendly and flexible working hours
• Possibility of Home-Office
• Modern workplaces in the heart of the Softwarepark Hagenberg
• Company events, pleasant working atmosphere, social benefits
• Equal opportunities for all genders and nationalities

Salary

The minimum gross salary is € 3656 per month (14 times per year) for full employment. The actual salary depends on the qualifications of the applicant.

We would like to increase the proportion of women in our organization and would be particularly pleased to be able to fill this position with a female researcher.

Are you interested? Applyand send the application documents to Email anzeigen. We are looking forward to an interview with you

title: Data Engineering Product Manager (m/f/x)
description: Company DescriptionDynatrace exists to make the world’s software work perfectly. Our unified software intelligence platform combines broad and deep observability and continuous runtime application security with the most advanced AIOps to provide answers and intelligent automation from data at an enormous scale. This enables innovators to modernize and automate cloud operations, deliver software faster and more securely, and ensure flawless digital experiences. That is why the world’s largest organizations trust Dynatrace® to accelerate digital transformation.   We're an equal opportunity employer and embrace all applicants. Dynatrace wants YOU—your diverse background, talents, values, ideas, and expertise. These qualities are what make our global team stronger and more seasoned. We're fueled by the diversity of our talented employees.   Job DescriptionDefine, manage, and execute a product roadmap for data engineering based on the needs of the business, stakeholder feedback, market... trends, and technical considerations.Inspire an experienced group of data engineers, breaking down complex problems into clearly defined requirements.Closely collaborate with data governance covering legal, security, and data quality aspects.Identify and monitor key performance indicators, using them to optimize and evolve our data strategy.Focus on measurable results covering time to market, scalability of solutions, and return on investment.Maintain a deep understanding of the data landscape, including emerging trends and market developments for new technologies to inform our data platform strategy.Qualifications5+ years of product management experience in a data-focused role.Practical experience in critical aspects of data engineering and business intelligence, focusing on data warehousing and data infrastructure operations.Strong knowledge of data engineering technologies, including SQL, ETL processes, data modeling, and cloud data warehousing (experience with Snowflake is a plus).Comprehensive understanding of delivering data products end-to-end.Excellent prioritization skills and working through them across dispersed teams.Experience working in an Agile development environment.Strong communicator across senior management, business stakeholders, and engineering teams.Must be data-driven and have a strong analytical mindset.Additional InformationWhat's in it for you? A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly. Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research. Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work. A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries. An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow. A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals. A truly international mindset that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team. A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side. Attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages. Compensation and rewardsWe offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages. Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 70.000 gross per year based on full-time employment. We offer a higher salary in line with qualifications and experience

title: Data Scientist/Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
LOCATION:
Kematen / Austria |
BRAND: IFE |
REQUISITION ID:
2703

IFE is the worldwide leading manufacturer of automatic entrance systems for railway vehicles. Wouldn’t it be great to play an active part in shaping the future of mobility?

We are an innovative company and use data from our door systems on railroad vehicles to predict future failures using Big Data analytics in the cloud. For this purpose, we are looking for someone to join our team for data analysis and development of algorithms for Condition Based Maintenance (CBM).

YOUR TASKS
• ANALYZE... the process and environment data of our train door systems.
• IDENTIFICATION... of anomalies
• DEVELOPMENT... of machine learning models
• DATA ENGINEERING... to further develop our data processing pipeline.
• COLLABORATION...through cross-disciplinary teamwork with development and services
• COMMUNICATION .....and visualization of results
• SHAPING... the mobility of the future

YOUR PROFILE
• Master in Data Science, Industrial... IT
• very good knowledge in Python or R
• experience with SPARK (DATABRICKS, Azure, AWS) an advantage
• experience with version management like Git, Devops
• good technical understanding (electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics, ...) an advantage
• experience in leading interdisciplinary teams
• ability to work independently
• very good knowledge of German and English

WHAT WE OFFER

Continuous innovation pushes the technological progress of our automatic entrance systems, which are geared towards quality, safety and reliability, and distinguishes us as an internationally reliable partner.

We offer you an exciting and varied job in an international environment as well as an attractive set of benefits. These range from flexible working time (up to 50% homeoffice) models through professional and personal development opportunities to sports and health care programmes.

The minimum salary for this position is EUR 3.500,00 gross monthly or more depending on qualifications and experience.

ARE YOU INTERESTED?

Apply now online if you want to advance in a strong team. We look forward to receiving your application

title: Data Scientist f/m/d
description:
• Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities using data and knowledge from the automotive domain to drive business solutions
• Design and implement metrics, applications and tools that will enable engineers to derive better conclusions (ad-hoc and automated analysis cases)
• Apply statistical modeling, learning and machine learning techniques to optimize processes and support engineering decisions
• Design graphical representations and visuals that engineers can easily interpret and understand
• Support the scale out of design algorithms via implementation in larger software frameworks
• Keep up to date on relevant technologies and frameworks, identify trends and propose new methods that the team could benefit from
• Ability and interest to extend knowledge beyond own field of expertise (e.g. powertrain, e-drive, battery, electronics, etc.)
• Active support and engagement for pre-sales and sales activities (RFQ, RFP handling)
• University degree... education (MSc, MEng or PhD) in Mathematics/Statistics, Informatics/Telematics or Computer Science
• Proven experience in applying data science methods in industrial use cases
• Strong proficiency in Python (optional: R, Scala, Julia or comparable) and experience in scalable processing environments like Spark or Dask preferable
• Strong soft skills in leadership, communication and facilitation in the teams and working with many different stakeholders with conflicting requirements and needs
• Strong problem-solving skills to help refining unclear problem statements and figure out how to solve them with the available data
• Experience building machine learning models in a professional environment
• Highly developed quality awareness with strong attention to details, ability to work in team, organizational skills
• Willingness to travel in the context of project execution
• German skills preferred, fluent in English
